package com.test;

public class BZ extends AZ {
	private int b;
	
	public BZ() {
		
	} // ∏ÌΩ√«œ¡ˆ æ æ“¡ˆ∏∏, default 

	public BZ(int b) {
		super();
		this.b = b;
	}
	
	
public BZ (int a, int b) {  // overrideø° ∏≈∞≥¿Œ¿⁄ 2∞≥ πﬁ¥¬ ª˝º∫¿⁄∞° æ¯æÓº≠ø©. ªı∑Œ ∏∏µÎ.
	super(a); //a¥¬ AA ≈¨∑°Ω∫∞≈ø©º≠ 
 	this.b=b ; // b¥¬ BB ≈¨∑°Ω∫.
}
	public int getB() {
		return b;
	}

	public void setB(int b) {
		this.b = b;
	}
	
	public int getHap() {
//		int hap = a + b ; // æ»µ  , a∞° private¿ÃæÓº≠ πŸ∑Œ »£√‚æ»µ 
		//int Hap = this.getA() + b ; // super∞° ¿÷¥¬µ• ±ª¿Ã object∏¶ b∑Œ µ•∑¡øÕº≠ »£√‚«œ¥¬∞« ∫∞∑Œ ¡¡¡ˆ æ ¿Ω
		//int Hap = this.getA()+ this.getB() ; // µ«±‰«œ¥¬µ•  A¥¬ ±ª¿Ã super∏¶ this∑Œ µ•∑¡ø√ « ø‰∞° æ¯¿Ω  // method¥¬ public¿ÃæÓº≠ »£√‚∞°¥….
		//int Hap = super.getA() + b ; // ∏‚πˆ∫Øºˆ¥¬ ¿∫¥–»≠«œ∞Ì ø¿«¬µ» ∏ﬁº“µÂ∑Œ »£√‚«œ¥¬∞‘ ¡¶¿œ ¡¡¿Ω.
		int Hap = getA() + getB() ; // æÓ∂≤ ¡∂∞«, validate «ﬁ¿ª∂ß, ∏ﬁº“µÂ »£√‚«œ¥¬∞‘ ∞°¿Â ¡§»Æ«‘. 
		
		return Hap ;
	}
	
	


}





160     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY09\src\com\test\FZ.java

package com.test;

public class FZ extends BZ {

	private int f;

	public FZ() {
	}

	public FZ(int f) { // ¿Ã∞… §¢∏∂∫˝«ﬂæÓ
		this.f=f;
	}

	public FZ(int a, int b, int f) {
		super(a, b); // public BB(int a, intb){super(a);}
		this.f = f;
	}

	

	public int getRes() {
		int r = getHap()-getF(); // get a+ get b ¥¬ ¿«πÃ∞° æ¯±∏ø©  // int res∑Œ º±æ«œΩ√∏È æ»µÀ¥œ¥Ÿ. 
		return r;
	}
	
	public int getF() {
		return f;
	}

	public void setF(int f) {
		this.f = f;
	}
}

// æÓ¡¶ «ﬂ∂≤ Tostring¿ª ø¨Ω¿«œ∞Ì ∞•∞‘ø©

public class MTest {
	@Override // override¿Œ¡ˆ æ∆¥—¡ˆ »Æ¿Œ «ÿ¡÷¥¬ ¡÷ºÆ±‚¥….
	public String toString() {
		return "≥™¿«¡÷º“¥¬" + super.toString(); // super = object (º±¡∂∞° ≥ª∞° ∏∏µÁ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ ∏Æ≈œ«ÿ¡Ÿ∞≈æﬂ)
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		/*
		 * System.out.println(new MTest()); System.out.println(new MTest().toString());
		 * 
		 * MTest m1=new MTest(); System.out.println(m1);
		 * System.out.println(m1.toString());
		 */

		MTest m1 = new MTest ();
		System.out.println(m1.hashCode());
		System.out.println(m1.getClass()); // object¿« ∞ÕµÈ¿ª ¥Ÿ ∞Æ∞Ìø¬¥Ÿ
		System.out.println(m1.getClass().getSimpleName());
		
		MTest m2 = new MTest ();
		System.out.println("µŒ∞≥¿« ∞¥√º∞° ∞∞¿∫¡ˆ ¥Ÿ∏•¡ˆ ¡÷º“ ∫Ò±≥:"+m1.equals(m2)); // equals µµ non static
		// object∞° ∞Æ∞Ì¿÷¥¬ ±‚∫ª ≈¨∑°Ω∫µÂ∏¶ ΩË¥Ÿ.
		
		

	}

	/*	@Override // ø¿∏•¬ πˆ∆∞ - source - override implement - ¿Á¡§¿««“ method∏¶ √£¥¬¥Ÿ.
	public boolean equals(Object obj) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		return super.equals(obj); */
	}






162     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY09\src\com\test\MTest01.java

package com.test;
// ¡÷º“∫Ò±≥∏¶ «’Ω√¥Ÿ.

class U_Class {

	String N_Name;

	public U_Class() {
	}

	public U_Class(String N_Name) {
		this.N_Name = N_Name;
	}

	// ø¿∏•¬  - source - hash code & equals : «¡∑Œ±◊∑•¿∫ ±‚∫ª¿˚¿∏∑Œ ¿Ã ƒ⁄µÂ∏¶ ¡‡æﬂµ≈. 
	// 1 ¡¶¿œ∏’¿˙ ∞¥√º¿« ¡÷º“(objectø° u_CLASS∞° ¡§»Æ«œ∞‘ π∞∑¡¿÷≥™), 
	// 2 null¿Œ∞° (¬¸¡∂∞°¿÷¥¬¡ˆæ¯¥¬¡ˆ, null ¿Ã∏È ¬¸¡∂«œ¥¬ ∞¸∞Ë∞° æ∆¥‘ = ∞¥√º∞° æ¯¿Ω), 
	// 3 «ÿ¥Á class ≈∏¿‘¿Œ¡ˆ æ∆¥—¡ˆ∏¶(ªÛº”¿Œ¡ˆ ππ æÓ¬æ∞«¡ˆ) ±◊¥Ÿ¿Ωø° override µ∆¿∏¥œ±Ó ∞™¿ª ∫Ò±≥«œ∞Ì µÓµÓµÓ ∫Ò±≥.
	
	// ≥™¡ﬂø° ≥ª∞° ¬ß ƒ⁄µÂ∏¶ æœ»£»≠ «œ∞Ì ΩÕ¿ª∂ß, hash ƒ⁄µÂ∏¶ ∫Ø∞Ê«œ∞ÌΩÕ?
	// ªÁΩ«, equasl ∞∞¿∫ ≥ª¿Â«‘ºˆµµ æÓ∂ª∞‘ ƒ⁄µÂ∞° ¬•¡Æ¿÷¥¬¡ˆ ∏∏ß. 
	@Override
	public int hashCode() {
		final int prime = 31;
		int result = 1;
		result = prime * result + ((N_Name == null) ? 0 : N_Name.hashCode());
		return result;
	}

	@Override
	public boolean equals(Object obj) {
		if (this == obj)
			return true;
		if (obj == null)
			return false;
		if (getClass() != obj.getClass())
			return false;
		U_Class other = (U_Class) obj;
		if (N_Name == null) {
			if (other.N_Name != null)
				return false;
		} else if (!N_Name.equals(other.N_Name))
			return false;
		return true;
	}
	
	
/*
// ¡÷º“ ¿Ãø‹ø° ∫Ò±≥∏¶ «“ ∂ß, ¿Á¡§¿«∏¶ ªÁøÎ«—¥Ÿ.
	@Override // ø¿∫Í¡ß∆Æ∞°∞Æ∞Ì¿÷¥¬ ¿Ãƒ˜¡Ó∏¶ ±◊¥Î∑Œ ¿Á¡§¿««œ∞⁄¥Ÿ¥¬ ∂Ê. ¿Ã ππæﬂ -_- æÓ∂≤ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∞° øÕµµ ¡÷º“∏¶ ∫Ò±≥«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ¥¬ ∏∂¿Ω∞°¡¸. ø¿∫Í¡ß∆Æ¿« ∏µÁ
				// ¿⁄ΩƒµÈ¿Ã ø√ ºˆ ¿÷¥Ÿ. other words ∏µÁ ≈¨∑°Ω∫¥¬ ¥Ÿ øÕµµ ¿⁄∑·«¸¿∫ æ»µ 
	public boolean equals(Object obj) { // u3.equals(u4) ¥œ±Ó, ∫Ò±≥«œ¥¬ ¥Á«œ¥¬ æ÷¥¬ U_Class u4
// u3. «œ∏È, u_class∞°µ«¡ˆ. u4.«ÿµµ u_class ¿›æ∆.
		// equals ¥¬ ∏µÁ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ πﬁæ∆º≠ ∫Ò±≥«œ¥œ±Ó.
//		u4∞° ≥—æÓø√∂ß, objectµµ ∞Æ∞ÌøÕ. u4∏∏ πﬁæ∆º≠ ∫Ò±≥«œ∞ÌΩÕ¿∫µ• ∞˝»£æ»ø°¥¬ u4¿« º±¡∂ ∏µÁ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∞° ¥Ÿ ¿÷¥Ÿ.
		// ¥ŸøÓ ƒ≥Ω∫∆√¿Ã « ø‰«— Ω√¡°. == > u_class∂Û∞Ì ¿˚§°, ∞·∞˙¿˚¿∏∑Œ ≥—æÓø¬ res∏¶ ¿˚∞Ì, ¥ŸøÓƒ≥Ω∫∆√¿∫ ∏ÌΩ√«¸ ƒ≥Ω∫∆√¿Ã¥œ±Ó ∏ÌΩ√∏¶
		// «ÿ¡ÿ¥Ÿ.
		// (U_clasS) obj ; ∂Û∞Ì ∏ÌΩ√«¸ ¥ŸøÓ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ «‘.
		U_Class res = (U_Class) obj;
		if (this.N_Name.equals(res.N_Name)) { // String class¿« ∫Ò±≥
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

//		 ∏∏æ‡ø° ≥ª∞° §°¿⁄∞Ì¿÷¥¬ this.N_Name¿Ã∂˚, res∞° ≥—æÓ∞Ô ∞™¿« N_Namd ∞·∞˙ ∞™¿Ã ∞Æ¥Ÿ∏È ∏Æ≈œ«ÿ∂Û. ±◊∑∏¡ˆ æ ¿∏∏È false.
	// return super.equals(obj); // obj∞° ø¬¥Ÿ±∏ø‰ø  !!
}

public class MTest01 {

	public static void main(String[] args) {

		U_Class u1 = new U_Class(); // U_Classø° πÊ¿ª «œ≥™ ∏∏µÈæÓº≠ ±◊ πÊ¿∫ u1¿Ã∂Û∞Ì ∏∏µÈ∞Ì

		System.out.println("¡÷º“∫Ò±≥ :" + (u1.equals(u2))); // equals ¥¬ object¿« ∞Õ¿”. u2øÕ ∞∞≥ƒ∞Ì π∞æÓ∫Ω ¿ßø° ∏Ì∑…æÓ∂˚ ∞∞¿∫∂Ê.
		// ≥™¥¬ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ ∏∏µÂ¥¬ ªÁ∂˜¿Œµ• ¡÷º“¥¬ ==¿Ã «ÿ¡÷¥œ±Ó, ≥™¥¬ ∞™∫Ò±≥∑Œ æ≤∞Ì ΩÕ¥‹∏ª¿Ãæﬂ. override (¿Á¡§¿«)∏¶ ≈Î«ÿº≠ «œ∞ÌΩÕ¥Ÿ.
		// ∏∏µÈæÓ∫∏¿⁄æ∆.
		// U_Class ø° ∫Øºˆ∏¶ «œ≥™ ∏∏µÈæÓ. N_Name ∫Øºˆ ∏∏µÈ∞Ì, classµµ ∏∏µÈæÓ¡‹.

		// sm7 4500 2017 // ¿Ã∑∏∞‘ ∏‚πˆ∫Øºˆ∞° ø©∑Ø∞≥ ¿œ∂ß obj∑Œ ≈Î¬∞∑Œ πﬁæ∆º≠ ∫Ò±≥«—¥¿∞‘ ∆Ì«‘.
		
		U_Class u3 = new U_Class("ππæﬂππæﬂ");
		U_Class u4 = new U_Class("∏€∏€∏€∏€");

		System.out.println("¡ˆ±›¿∫¡÷º“∫Ò±≥ : " + u3.equals(u4));

		// public boolean equals(Object anObject) << æÍ∏¶ ∞Æ§ß æ≤∏Èµ≈ ?
		// Compares this string to the specified object. The result is true if and only
		// if the argument is not null and is a String object that represents the same
		// sequence of characters as this object.

		System.out.println("ππæﬂππæﬂ".equals("ππæﬂππæﬂ")); // πÆ¿⁄ø≠≥¢∏Æ ∫Ò±≥ ∞°¥….

	}}

public class MTest011 {

	public static void main(String[] args) {

		U_Class u1 = new U_Class(); // U_Classø° πÊ¿ª «œ≥™ ∏∏µÈæÓº≠ ±◊ πÊ¿∫ u1¿Ã∂Û∞Ì ∏∏µÈ∞Ì
		U_Class u2 = new U_Class(); // U_Classø° πÊ¿ª ∂« «œ≥™ ∏∏µÈæÓº≠ ±◊ πÊ¿∫ u2¿Ã∂Û∞Ì ∏∏µÈ∞Ì

		System.out.println("¡÷º“∫Ò±≥ :" + (u1 == u2)); // ¡÷º“∞° ∞∞¿∫¡ˆ π∞æÓ≥™∫Ω.
		System.out.println("¡÷º“∫Ò±≥ :" + (u1.equals(u2))); // equals ¥¬ object¿« ∞Õ¿”. u2øÕ ∞∞≥ƒ∞Ì π∞æÓ∫Ω ¿ßø° ∏Ì∑…æÓ∂˚ ∞∞¿∫∂Ê.
		// ≥™¥¬ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ ∏∏µÂ¥¬ ªÁ∂˜¿Œµ• ¡÷º“¥¬ ==¿Ã «ÿ¡÷¥œ±Ó, ≥™¥¬ ∞™∫Ò±≥∑Œ æ≤∞Ì ΩÕ¥‹∏ª¿Ãæﬂ. override (¿Á¡§¿«)∏¶ ≈Î«ÿº≠ «œ∞ÌΩÕ¥Ÿ.
		// ∏∏µÈæÓ∫∏¿⁄æ∆.
		// U_Class ø° ∫Øºˆ∏¶ «œ≥™ ∏∏µÈæÓ. N_Name ∫Øºˆ ∏∏µÈ∞Ì, classµµ ∏∏µÈæÓ¡‹.

		
		// sm7 5000 2018
		// sm7 4500 2017 // ¿Ã∑∏∞‘ ∏‚πˆ∫Øºˆ∞° ø©∑Ø∞≥ ¿œ∂ß obj∑Œ ≈Î¬∞∑Œ πﬁæ∆º≠ ∫Ò±≥«—¥¿∞‘ ∆Ì«‘.
		
		U_Class u3 = new U_Class("ππæﬂππæﬂ");
		U_Class u4 = new U_Class("∏€∏€∏€∏€");

		System.out.println("¡ˆ±›¿∫¡÷º“∫Ò±≥ : " + u3.equals(u4));

		// Compares this string to the specified object. The result is true if and only
		// if the argument is not null and is a String object that represents the same
		// sequence of characters as this object.

		System.out.println("ππæﬂππæﬂ".equals("ππæﬂππæﬂ")); // πÆ¿⁄ø≠≥¢∏Æ ∫Ò±≥ ∞°¥….
		System.out.println("ø÷ø©ø÷ø©".equals("ππæﬂππæﬂ")); // πÆ¿⁄ø≠≥¢∏Æ ∫Ò±≥ ∞°¥…. // class∞° string ¿Ã¥œ±Óø©.

	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {

164     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY09\src\com\test\MTest02.java

package com.test;
// ªÛº”«“∞‘ø© :)

// ¡§Ω≈¿ª ∂»∂Ï ¬˜∏Æ∞Ì∫∏¿⁄.

class AA {

	// ∏ÌΩ√ ª˝º∫¿⁄∏¶ ∏∏µÈæÓ ∫∏∞⁄§µ∫Ïµ§ø.
	public AA(int a) {
		System.out.println("AA Constructor");
	}
}

class BB extends AA { //
	public BB() {
		super (100) ;
		// super ∞° AA ≈¨∑°Ω∫¿« ±‚∫ªª˝º∫¿⁄∏¶ »£√‚«—¥Ÿ. ø÷ super≥ƒ∏È, ∏µÁ super∏¶ ∫“∑Øø√ ºˆ ¿÷? æ≤∞«æ»æ≤∞« default∑Œ
		// µÈæÓ¿÷¥Ÿ. ∏Ì§µ«ﬁ¿∏¥œ±Ó ∏ÌΩ√µ» ª˝º∫¿⁄∏¶ »£√‚«œ∞⁄≥◊ ? ±◊∑°º≠ super∞° ¿÷∞« æ¯∞« error∞° æ»≥≥¥œ¥Ÿ. but if AAø° int a ∫Øºˆ∞° ¿÷¥Ÿ∏È,
		// ¡ˆøÏ∏È πŸ∑Œ errror superø÷ ≥÷æ¸¥¬¡ˆµµ ¿Ã«ÿæ»µ  ππæﬂ. ¿Ã ≈∞øˆµÂ¥¬ §≤≥™µÂΩ√ √π¡Ÿø° Ω· ¡›¥œ¥Ÿ.  
		// this(); µµ √π¡Ÿø° æπ§§µ§ø.
		// super / this µ— ¡ﬂø° «œ≥™∏∏ æπ¥œ¥Ÿ. 
		// extends∂Û¥¬ ∞… º±æ«œ∏È, ±‚∫ªª˝º∫¿⁄ super∞° ª˝∑´µ» «¸≈¬. ≥ª∫Œ¿˚¿∏∑Œ super∞¥√º(=defaultª˝º∫¿⁄)∞° Ω…æÓ¡Æ ¿÷æÓæﬂ
		// AA∏¶ ∫“∑Øø√ ºˆ ¿÷¥Ÿ∞Ì «’¥œ¥Ÿ.
		System.out.println("BB Constructor");
	}
} // ¥Ÿ¿ÃæÓ±◊∑•¿ª ∫∏¿⁄. æÓ¡¶ ∫ª ±◊∏≤¿Ã∂˚¿∫ »≠ªÏ√À¿Ã ¥Ÿ∏£¥‰¥œ¥Ÿ. ¿Ã≥  ππæÓ¬º∞Ì «ﬂ¿›æ∆ø©.

public class MTest02 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		BZ b1 = new BZ(); // AA () -> BB () // ¡÷º“ 2∞≥¬•∏Æ∞° ¬¸¡∂∞° µ«¡Æ. ¬¸¡∂ ¡÷º“¿« Ω√¿€¿Ã AA∂ı ∏ª¿‘¥œ¥Ÿ. ∞¯√•¿ª ∫æ¥œ¥Ÿ. 2p

	System.out.println(b1 instanceof BZ);

	System.out.println(b1 instanceof AA);
	// System.out.println(b1 instanceof Integer); æ»µÀ¥œ¥Ÿ.
	System.out.println(b1 instanceof Object); // super clas∞° object ¿Ã±‚∂ßπÆ.
	
	// class , ªÛº” , ¥Ÿ«¸º∫ ºº∞°¡ˆ ¡ﬂø° µŒ∞°¡ˆ πËøÚ :) ¥Ÿ«¸º∫ «œ∏È øˆ≈©º•¿ª «œ∞⁄∂ﬂ§≥¥œ¥Ÿ.
	// ∞°¿Â ¡ﬂø‰«—∞« class ≥ª¿« ª˝º∫¿⁄. ª˝º∫ «—¥Ÿ∞Ì «œ∏È π´¡∂∞« ª˝º∫¿⁄∞° ¿÷æÓæﬂ «’¥œ¥Ÿ. ª˝º∫¿⁄∂Ûµµ ¿÷æÓæﬂ «’¥œ¥Ÿ. ª˝º∫¿⁄¥¬ «◊ªÛ newøÕ «‘≤≤ «’Ω√¥Ÿ
	
	}
}





165     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY09\src\com\test\MTest03.java

package com.test;

public class MTest03 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

	// case 1 : ∞¥√º∏¶ √ ±‚»≠ (∫ÛπÊ¿ª ∏∏µÈæÓº≠), a=100, b=50¿ª ≥÷æÓº≠ «’¿ª ∏Æ≈œ«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ.
		BZ b1 = new BZ () ; // new BB()∏¶ »£√‚«œ∞Ì new AA »£√‚«œ¥¬ πÊπ˝ . ∞¥√ºª˝º∫¿∫ AA()∞° ∏’¿˙ ª˝º∫, BB()∞° ¥Ÿ¿Ωª˝º∫
		b1.setA(100);
		b1.setB(50);
		
		System.out.println("a="+b1.getA()+ "  b="+b1.getB());
		System.out.println("hap= "+b1.getHap());
		
		// case 2 : √ ±‚∞™ 200, 300¿ª ∞¢∞¢ aøÕ bø° ¥Î¿‘«œ∏Èº≠ «’¿ª ∏Æ≈œ«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ.
	BZ b2=new BZ(200,300); // a=200, b=300
	System.out.println(b2.getHap());
	
	 // case 3 : ∫Øºˆ f∏¶ ∞¸∏Æ«œ¥¬ FZ∂Û¥¬ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ ∏∏µÈæÓº≠ 
	// BB≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ ªÛº”πﬁæ∆ (a+b) = f∑Œ ±∏«ˆµ«¥¬ ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ ¿€º∫«ÿ∫∏¿⁄.
	
	FZ f1 = new FZ(300,200,60);//(300+200)-50 =450
	System.out.println(f1.getRes());
		}
}





166     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY09\src\com\test02\DZ.java

package com.test02;

import com.test.AZ;

public class DZ extends AZ{

	private int d ;
	public DZ() {}
	public DZ (int d) {
		this.d=d;
		
	}
	
	// get A()∏¶ »£√‚«“ ºˆ ¿÷¥¬ ¿Ã¿±§§ ? ¥Ÿ∏•∆–≈∞¡ˆ¿« º±¡∂, ªÛº”Ω√ get A()¿« ¡¢±Ÿ ¡¶«—¿⁄∞° public¿Ã±‚ ∂ßπÆ¿Ã¥Ÿ.
	 // protected ¿Ã∏È, πŸ∑Œ ø°∑Ø, ∫“∑Øø√ ºˆ∞° æ¯¥Ÿ.
	// protected ¿«πÃ : ¥Ÿ∏• pkgø°º≠ ∞°¡Æ∞•ºˆ æ¯∞‘«œ±‚ ¿ß«ÿº≠. 

	public int getRes() {
		return getA() ^ getD();
	}
	public int getD() {
		return d;
	}
	public void setD(int d) {
		this.d = d;
	}
	
}

package com.test03;
// ¿Á¡§¿«∏¶ «“±Ó«’¥œ¥Ÿ.

// ¡ˆø™/ ¿¸ø™¿« ±‚¡ÿ¿∫ method. // method æ»¿∫ ¡ˆø™∫Øºˆ , π€¿∫ ¿¸ø™∫Øºˆ
// Ω««‡¿« ¥‹¿ß¥¬ class / ∏Ì∑… ºˆ«‡¿« ¥‹¿ß∞° method.

// ∏ﬁ∏∏Æø°ø√∂Û∞°∏È æÓ∂ª∞‘ µ… ∞Õ¿Œ∞°.

// BTest b1 = new BTest();
//

class ATest {

	public void prn() {
		System.out.println("A Prn"); // super.prn ¿Ã∞Ì
	}
}

class BTest extends ATest {
	public void disp() {
		System.out.println("B disp");
		
	}

	public void prn() {
		 super.prn();
		System.out.println("BB Prn"); // this.prn ¿Ã±‚ ∂ßπÆø° º≠∑Œ ¥ﬁ∂Ûº≠ ø¿∑˘∞° æ»≥≠¥Ÿ∞Ì ª˝∞¢«ÿ º≠∑Œ. ¿⁄±‚µÈ≥¢∏Æ Ωƒ∫∞¿Ã ∞°¥…«œ±‚ ∂ßπÆ.
		// ¡ˆø™¿Ã∞« ¿¸ø™¿Ã∞« ∂»∞∞¿∫ ±∏ø™ø° Ωƒ∫∞¿⁄ æ≤∏È ±∏∫∞¿Ã æ»µ«¿›æ∆. 
  System.out.println("==================");}
}

public class MTest01 { // ø©±‚º≠ ∞¥√§∏¶ ª˝º∫«œø© ªÁøÎ«œ∞‘µ«∏È, ≥ª∞° ¥©±∏∂Û∞Ì ∏ª«œ¡ˆ æ ¿∏∏È, ¿¸√º ¡÷º“¿« Ω√¿€¡÷º“∏¶ ∞∞¿Ã ∞Æ∞Ì¿÷±‚ ∂ßπÆø° Ωƒ∫∞¿◊ §ø§§µ»¥Ÿ.
	// b1.«œ∞‘µ«∏È, ATest øÕ BTest¿« ¡÷º“∏¶ µ—¥Ÿ∞Æ∞Ì ¿÷±‚ ∂ßπÆø°, «ˆ¿Á object¿« prn¿Œ this.prn;¿ª ∫“∑Øø¿∞‘µ»¥Ÿ±∏ø©.
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		BTest b1 = new BTest(); // ATest() -> BTest() πÊ«‚¿∏∑Œ ≈Ωªˆ«œ∞‘ µ  // ø©±‚º≠ this¥¬ new BTestæﬂ.
		b1.prn(); // b1.prn = this.prn ¿Ã∂Û¥¬ ∂Ê.«ˆ¿Á ø¿∫Í¡ß∆Æ¿« ¡÷º“∞° b1.prnø° ¿÷¥‰¥œ¥Ÿ (ªÁΩ«¿Ã∞«æ∆¥“ºˆµµ¿÷¥Ÿ)
		// ATest().Prn ->BTest().Prn () µøΩ√ø° »£√‚«ÿº≠ ∏Ì∑…¿ª Ω««‡«œ¥¬µ• º¯º≠¥Î∑Œ «œ¥ı∂Û. ±◊∑°º≠ duplicate.√Îº“∞° µ«µµ∑œ ∏∏µÈæ˘¥Ÿ.
// ø÷ override∂Û∞Ì«“±Ó.
// º±¡∂∂˚ ∞∞æ∆æﬂ«œ¥œ±Ó. 
// ¥©±∫∞°∞° ¡§¿««— ∏ﬁº“µÂ¿« ¡§¿«∏¶ ªı∑Œ«œ¥¬∞…, annotation¿ª ∞…∏È, º±¡∂∞° ∞°¡¯ prn∏ﬁº“µÂ∏¶ »£√‚«ÿº≠ »ƒº’¿« ¡÷º“∑Œ ¡§¿«∏¶ ¥ŸΩ√ «—∞Õ.
///
		ATest a1 = new ATest();
		a1.prn();
		
		ATest a2 = new BTest(); // 
		a2.prn();
		//a2.disp(); // æÍ¥¬ ∞Æ∞Ì ø√ ºˆ∞° æ¯¿Ω. ∏ﬁ∏∏Æ ∞Æ∞Ì ø√∂Û∞•∂ß, »ƒº’∞≈ prn∏∏ ªÏ∑¡º≠ Aø° ø√∑¡º≠ A.prn¿∫ AµÁ BµÁ ªÛ∞¸æ¯¿Ã ¥Ÿ µÈ∞Ìø».
		 // A¿Ã∏ß¿ª ∞°¡Æ¥Ÿ∞° ¥Ÿ∏£∞‘ ΩË±‚ ∂ßπÆø° A¥¬ B¿« prn¿Ã ¿⁄±‚≤®∂Û∞Ì ª˝∞¢«‘. 
		// ¥ŸøÓƒ≥Ω∫∆√ ππ ±◊µ˝∞≈ æ¯¿Ω. Ωƒ∫∞«“ºˆæ¯¿ª ∂ß¥¬ 
		b1.prn();
		b1.disp();
		
		
	}
}

package com.test03;

class My {

	public void Myprn() {
		System.out.println("My prn()");
	}
}

public class MTest02 {
	public static void Disp(My m) { // My m = new My (); «ÿæﬂµ«¿›æ∆. ±Ÿµ• ø∑ø° My m ∑Œ πÊ¿ª ∏∏µÈæÓº≠ ∏≈∞≥¿Œ¿⁄∑Œ new my∏¶ πﬁ¿∏∏È æÓ¬˜«« ∂»∞∞¿Ã µ«¿›æ∆.

		m.Myprn(); // ¡ˆ±›∫∏∞Ì ¿Ã∑∏∞‘ µ«≥™∫∏¥Ÿ «œ¿⁄.
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {

			@Override
			public void Myprn() { // «—π¯¬Î¿∫ ¿⁄±‚ ¿⁄Ω≈¿ª ¿Á¡§¿««ÿº≠ æµ ºˆ ¿÷∞‘ «ÿ¡ÿ¥‰¥œ¥Ÿ. ø¯∑°¥¬ ¿ß∏¶ √‚∑¬«ÿæﬂµ«¥¬µ• ªı∑Œ ¿Á¡§¿««“∞≈æﬂ. ø÷ ±◊∑±¡ˆ ∏∏£∞⁄¥¬µ•ø©.

				// ¿Ã∏ß¿∫ µø¿œ«—µ• ∏Ì∑…ºˆ«‡¿ª ¥ŸΩ√«—¥Ÿ¥¬∞≈æﬂ. ø÷ ? ∏ﬁº“µÂ∏¶ ªı∑Œ ∏∏µÈ∏È§∑ §ø§§µ«≥™ø© ?
				 // ¿Ã∏ß(¡÷º“)¿ª ∞°¡Æ¥Ÿ ¡§¿«∏∏ ªı∑”∞‘. ¿Œ§ß§°Ω∫ø° ¿˙¿Âµ» æ÷∏¶ µ•∑¡¥Ÿ∞° ªı∑”∞‘ ±‚¥…¿ª ¿Á¡§¿« «ﬁ¿∏¥œ±Ó æÍ∏¶ »£√‚«“ ºˆ π€ø°.

170     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY10\src\com\test\MTest.java

package com.test;

import java.awt.Frame; // FRAME class∏¶ ªÛº”πﬁæ“¥Ÿ. Layout πËƒ°«œ¥¬ æ÷∞° ¿÷¥Ÿ∞Ì «ÿº≠ »Æ¿Œ¿ª «ﬂ¥Ÿ. ≥°.
import java.awt.Button;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;

public class MTest extends Frame {

	Button button1, button2, button3;

	public void init() {
	         button1 = new Button("Ok");
	         button2 = new Button("Open");
	         button3 = new Button("Close");
	         add(button1); // add¥¬ Frame¿ßø° ¿÷¥¬ º±¡∂¿« ∞Õ.
	         add(button2);
	         add(button3);
	         setLayout(new FlowLayout()); // ≥≤¿«≈¨∑°Ω∫∞Æ∞Ìø√∂©ª˝º∫¿⁄ (APIø°º≠ CONTR¿ª µ⁄¡Æ∫∏¿⁄)
setSize(200,200);
setVisible(true);
}
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
MTest a1 = new MTest();
a1.init();
System.out.println(a1.getLayout()); // ¿¸¥ﬁ π◊ ∫Ø∞Ê¿∫ setlayout¿Õ§∂¡ˆ.
	
	
	}
	}





171     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY10\src\com\test\MTest01.java

package com.test;

import java.awt.*;

public class MTest01 extends Frame { // ≥™∏∏¿« ∑π¿Ãæ∆øÙ¿ª ∏∏µÈ±‚ ¿ß«ÿ Frame¿ª ªÛº”πﬁ¥¬¥Ÿ.

	Panel p1, p2, p3;

	public MTest01() { // ±‚∫ªª˝º∫¿⁄
		// super(); frame¿« ª˝º∫¿⁄∏¶ ∞°∏£≈µ¥œ¥Ÿ. = frame();
		// CONSTR∏¶ ∫∏¥œ±Ó ¬™¿∫æ÷∏¶ ∫ª¥Ÿ Frame(String title)
		super("≥ª∞°∏∏µÁ «¡∑π¿”");// º±¡∂∏¶ »£√‚«œ¥¬ ª˝º∫¿⁄. super
		p1 = new Panel();
		p2 = new Panel();
		p3 = new Panel();

	}

	public void go() {// component ¿€æ˜¿ª ø©±‚º≠ «ÿ∫æΩ√¥Ÿ.
		//// panel
		p1.setBackground(Color.BLUE);
		p2.setBackground(Color.red);
		p3.setBackground(Color.GRAY);
		//// Frame
		add(p1);
		add(p2);
		add(p3);

		setLayout(new GridLayout(1, 3));
		setSize(2000, 200);
		setVisible(true);

	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {

//		new MTest01 ();  ∏∏«œ∏È ∏∏µÈ∞Ì æ»∫∏ø©¡‹. ∫∏ø©¡÷¥¬ ∏Ì∑…æÓ∞° æ¯¿›æ∆ø© 
		new MTest01().go(); // ±Ó¡ˆ «ÿæﬂ ∫∏ø©¡‹.vsibla

	}
}





172     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY10\src\com\test\MTest02.java

package com.test;

import java.awt.*;

public class MTest02 extends Frame {

	////// panel
	Panel p1, p2, p3; // 1 º±æ«œ∞Ì ª˝º∫¿⁄∞°º≠ ª°∏Æ ª˝º∫«—¥Ÿ.
	/////// p1
	Label lbName, lbAddr, lbPhone;
	TextField txtName, txtAddr, txtPhone; // º±æ º±æ

	/////// p2
	Button btok, btcn;

	////// p3
	TextArea textview;

	public MTest02() {

		super("¡÷º“∑œ");
		p1 = new Panel(); // 2 ø©±‚¥Ÿ ª˝º∫¿ª «—¥Ÿ. ¿ﬂ«ﬂΩ¿¥œ¥Ÿ ¬¶¬¶¬¶ :) API - CONSTR
		p2 = new Panel();
		p3 = new Panel();
		//////////////// label ¿⁄∏Æ "A label displays a single line of read-only text."
		lbName = new Label(" ¿Ã  ∏ß  "); /// Label(String text) constrø° ¿Ã∑∏∞‘ æ≤∂Û∞Ì ≥™øÕ¿÷æ˙¿›æ∆.
		lbAddr = new Label("¡÷ º“");
		lbPhone = new Label("¥œπ¯»≠π¯»£");

		//////////////// text field ¿⁄∏Æ (API - CONSTR - TextField(String text, int
		//////////////// columns)
		txtName = new TextField("", 30);
		txtAddr = new TextField("", 30);
		txtPhone = new TextField("", 30);
		//////////////////////// Button API - CONSTR Button(String label)
		btok = new Button("»Æ¿Œ");
		btcn = new Button("√Îº“");
		////////////////////// TextArea TextArea(String text)
		textview = new TextArea("∞®ªÁ«’¥œ¥Á", 5, 100);

	}

	public void go() {
		////// panel

		/////// p1
		p1.setLayout(new GridLayout(3, 2)); // ∑π¿Ãæ∆øÙ ª˝º∫
		p1.add(lbName);
		p1.add(txtName); // ª˝º∫«—∞… panelø° ø√∏∞¥Ÿ.
		p1.add(lbAddr);
		p1.add(txtAddr);
		p1.add(lbPhone);
		p1.add(txtPhone);

		/////// p2

		p2.add(btok);
		p2.add(btcn);

		////// p3
		p3.add(textview);

		////// Frame
		setLayout(new GridLayout(3, 1));
		add(p1);
		add(p2);	
		add(p3);
		
		setSize(1500, 1000);
		setVisible(true);
		setFont(new Font("µ∏øÚ", Font.BOLD, 25)); // java.awt.Font constructor : Font(String name, int style, int size)
		p1.setBackground(Color.BLUE);
	
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {

		new MTest02().go();

	}
}

174     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY10\src\com\test\MTest031.java

package com.test;

import java.awt.*;


public class MTest031 extends Frame {
	Panel p1;
	TextField A, B, Res;
	List mcalc;
	Button ok;

	public MTest031() {

		super("Calc");
		p1 = new Panel();
	

		
		A = new TextField("",5);
		B = new TextField("",5);
		Res = new TextField("",5);
		mcalc = new List(4, false);
		mcalc.add("      +");
		mcalc.add("      -");
		mcalc.add("      x");
		mcalc.add("      /");

		ok = new Button("=");

	}

	public void go() {
		
	
		p1.add(A);

		
		p1.add(mcalc);
		
	
		p1.add(B);
		
		
		p1.add(ok);
		
		
		
		p1.add(Res);

		setLayout(new GridLayout(1, 1));
		add(p1);
		

		setSize(500, 200);
		setVisible(true);
	
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {

		new MTest031().go();
	}
}

176     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY10\src\com\test02\MyAddress.java

package com.test02;

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.*;
	

public class MyAddress extends JFrame {

	////// panel
	JPanel p1, p2, p3; // 1 º±æ«œ∞Ì ª˝º∫¿⁄∞°º≠ ª°∏Æ ª˝º∫«—¥Ÿ.
	/////// p1
	JLabel lbName, lbAddr, lbPhone;
	JTextField txtName, txtAddr, txtPhone; // º±æ º±æ

	/////// p2
	JButton btok, btcn;

	////// p3
	JTextArea textview;

	public MyAddress() {

		super("¡÷º“∑œ");
		p1 = new JPanel(); // 2 ø©±‚¥Ÿ ª˝º∫¿ª «—¥Ÿ. ¿ﬂ«ﬂΩ¿¥œ¥Ÿ ¬¶¬¶¬¶ :) API - CONSTR
		p2 = new JPanel();
		p3 = new JPanel();
		//////////////// label ¿⁄∏Æ "A label displays a single line of read-only text."
		lbName = new JLabel(" ¿Ã  ∏ß  "); /// Label(String text) constrø° ¿Ã∑∏∞‘ æ≤∂Û∞Ì ≥™øÕ¿÷æ˙¿›æ∆.
		lbAddr = new JLabel("¡÷ º“");
		lbPhone = new JLabel("¥œπ¯»≠π¯»£");

		//////////////// text field ¿⁄∏Æ (API - CONSTR - TextField(String text, int
		//////////////// columns)
		txtName = new JTextField("", 30);
		txtAddr = new JTextField("", 30);
		txtPhone = new JTextField("", 30);
		//////////////////////// Button API - CONSTR Button(String label)
		btok = new JButton("»Æ¿Œ");
		btcn = new JButton("√Îº“");
		////////////////////// TextArea TextArea(String text)
		textview = new JTextArea("∞®ªÁ«’¥œ¥Á", 5, 100);

	}

	public void go() {
		////// panel

		/////// p1
		p1.setLayout(new GridLayout(3, 2)); // ∑π¿Ãæ∆øÙ ª˝º∫
		p1.add(lbName);
		p1.add(txtName); // ª˝º∫«—∞… panelø° ø√∏∞¥Ÿ.
		p1.add(lbAddr);
		p1.add(txtAddr);
		p1.add(lbPhone);
		p1.add(txtPhone);

		/////// p2

		p2.add(btok);
		p2.add(btcn);

		////// p3
		p3.add(textview);

		////// Frame
		setLayout(new GridLayout(3, 1));

		add(p1);
		add(p2);
		add(p3);

		setSize(1500, 1000);
		setVisible(true);
		setFont(new Font("µ∏øÚ", Font.BOLD, 25)); // java.awt.Font constructor : Font(String name, int style, int size)
		p1.setBackground(Color.BLUE);
		p2.setBackground(Color.red);
		p3.setBackground(Color.GRAY);
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {

		new MyAddress().go();

	}
}





177     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY10_WS\src\com\exam\Mtest05.java

package com.exam;

import java.util.*;

public class Mtest05 {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// µ•¿Ã≈Õ ≈∏¿‘ ∫Œ≈Õ º±æ ∏’¿˙ «’Ω√¥Ÿ.
		String name = null;
		int kor =0, eng = 0, mat=0 , hap = 0;
		double avg = 0.0;
		
		// ∞™ ¥Î¿‘
		Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
		System.out.println("¥ÁΩ≈¿« ¿Ã∏ß¿∫ π´æ˘¿‘¥œ±Ó ?");
		name = sc.nextLine();
		System.out.println("±πæÓ ¡°ºˆ∏¶ ¿‘∑¬«ÿ");   // nextint ∑Œ «ÿµµ µ»¥Ÿ
		kor = sc.nextInt();
				System.out.println("øµæÓ ¡°ºˆ∏¶ ¿‘∑¬«ÿ");
		eng = sc.nextInt();
		System.out.println("ºˆ«– ¡°ºˆ∏¶ ¿‘∑¬«ÿ");
		mat = sc.nextInt();

		hap = kor + eng + mat;
		avg = (double)hap / 3;
		
		//√‚∑¬
		System.out.println("¿Ã∏ß: " + name);
		System.out.printf("«’∞Ë¡°ºˆ : %10d ¡° ¿‘¥œ¥Ÿ. √‡«œ«’¥œ¥Á><\n", hap);
		System.out.printf("∆Ú±’¡°ºˆ : %10.1f ¡° ¿‘¥œ¥Ÿ. √‡«œ«’¥œ¥Á><", avg);
	}
}

package com.exam;

public class Test011 {

	public static void MyView(String a, String b) { // ø©±‚µµ ¡ˆø™∫Øºˆ
		// String a = 90; // ø©±‚µµ ¡ˆø™∫Øºˆø©º≠ πÊ µŒ∞≥ ∏∏µÁ∞Õ√≥∑≥ µ»¥Ÿ.
		// String b = 80;

		int a1 = Integer.parseInt(a);
		int b1 = Integer.parseInt(b);

		// System.out.printf("%5d * %5d = %5d",a1,b1,(a1*b1));

		String str = String.format("%5d * %5d = %5d", a1, b1, (a1 * b1));
		System.out.println(str);
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {
// ∏ﬁ¿Œ¿∏∑Œ∫Œ≈Õ µŒ ∞≥¿« ∞™¿ª πﬁæ∆ aøÕ b¿« ¥Î¿‘¿ª «œ∞Ì a*b = ?

		// String b = "80";
		String a = args[0];
		String b = args[1]; // Ω««‡«“∂ß, run as configuration / argument $(String_prompt)

		MyView(a, b); // public static void MyVew(a,b)
					  // public static String MyView02(a,b)

	}

}

package com.exam;
// non_static¿∏∑Œ ∏∏µÈæÓ∫∏¿⁄.
public class Test013 {
	
	public String MyView 03(String a, String b) { 

		int a1 = Integer.parseInt(a);
		int b1 = Integer.parseInt(b);

		String str = String.format("%5d * %5d = %5d", a1, b1, (a1 * b1));
		return str;	}
	
	public static String MyView(String a, String b) { // ø©±‚µµ ¡ˆø™∫Øºˆ
		// String a = 90; // ø©±‚µµ ¡ˆø™∫Øºˆø©º≠ πÊ µŒ∞≥ ∏∏µÁ∞Õ√≥∑≥ µ»¥Ÿ.
		// String b = 80;

		int a1 = Integer.parseInt(a);
		int b1 = Integer.parseInt(b);

		// System.out.printf("%5d * %5d = %5d",a1,b1,(a1*b1));

		String str = String.format("%5d * %5d = %5d", a1, b1, (a1 * b1));
		return str;	}

	
	
	public static void main(String[] args) {
// ∏ﬁ¿Œ¿∏∑Œ∫Œ≈Õ µŒ ∞≥¿« ∞™¿ª πﬁæ∆ aøÕ b¿« ¥Î¿‘¿ª «œ∞Ì a*b = ?

//		String a = "90"; 
		// String b = "80";
		String a = args[0];
		String b = args[1]; // Ω««‡«“∂ß, run as configuration / argument $(String_prompt)

//		MyView(a, b); // public static void MyVew(a,b)
					  // public static String MyView02(a,b)
 String res = MyView(a,b);
 System.out.println("∞·∞˙ : " + res);

 System.out.println("non_static »£√‚«ÿ∫∏¿⁄.");
 new Test01().Myview03(a,b);
  String res02 = new Test01().Myview04(a,b);
 System.out.println("∞·∞˙ : " + res);
 
	}

}

package com.exam;
/*
 * [πÆ¡¶2]65430ø¯¿ª ∏∏µÈ±‚ ¿ß«— »≠∆Û¿« ∞πºˆ∏¶ ±∏«œΩ√ø¿._ ¥‹º¯ ªÁƒ¢ø¨ªÍ¿∏∑Œ∏∏.!
money = 65430ø¯
∏∏ø¯ = 6
√µø¯ = 5
πÈø¯ = 4
Ω ø¯ = 3
 * */
public class Test02 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		int money = 65430 ;
		int man = (int) (money/10000);
		int ch = (int) (money-(man*10000) )/1000;
		int bg = (int) (money-(man*10000 + ch*1000)) /100;
		int sp = (int) (money-(man*10000 + ch*1000+ bg*100))/10;
 		System.out.println("∏∏ø¯ : " + man);
		System.out.println("√µø¯ : " +ch);
		System.out.println("πÈø¯ : " +bg);
		System.out.println("Ω ø¯ : " + sp);
	}

}

πÿ∫Ø :  20  
≥Ù¿Ã :   6

		System.out.println("πÿ∫Ø: ");

		System.out.println("≥Ù¿Ã: ");
		 N = sc.nextFloat();
		
		 float MN = (float) (M*N)/2 ;

188     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\new.java






189     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\exam\Student.java

package com.exam;

public class Student {
	private String name ;
	private int age ;
	private int height ;
	private int weight ;
	
	
	
	
	public Student() {


	}

	public Student(String name, int age, int height, int weight) {
		super();
		this.name = name;
		this.age = age;
		this.height = height;
		this.weight = weight;
	}

	public String getName() {
		return name;
	}

	public void setName(String name) {
		this.name = name;
	}

	public int getAge() {
		return age;
	}

	public void setAge(int age) {
		this.age = age;
	}

	public int getHeight() {
		return height;
	}

	public void setHeight(int height) {
		this.height = height;
	}

	public int getWeight() {
		return weight;
	}

	public void setWeight(int weight) {
		this.weight = weight;
	}
	
	


}

package com.exam;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

public class StudentTest {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

Student st1 = new Student ("πŒµÈ∑π",15,170,65);
Student st2 = new Student ("¡¯¥ﬁ∑°",22,165,53);
Student st3 = new Student ("∞≥≥™∏Æ",20,155,43);

System.out.printf("%10s %5s %5s %5s\n", "¿Ã∏ß","≥™¿Ã","Ω≈¿Â","∏ˆπ´∞‘");
System.out.println("============================================");

StudentView sv = new StudentView(); // StudentView∞¥√º∏¶ ∏∏µÈæÓ viewStudent∏ﬁº≠µÂø° °ÆπŒµÈ∑°°Æ∞¥√º∏¶ ≥—±‰¥Ÿ 
sv.viewStudent(st1);
System.out.println("\n\n");

List<Student> all = new ArrayList<>(); // StudentView∞¥√º∏¶ ∏∏µÈæÓ viewStudentList∏ﬁº≠µÂø° ArrsyList∞¥ √º∏¶ ≥—±‰¥Ÿ 
all.add(st1);
all.add(st2);
all.add(st3);

sv.viewStudentList(all);
	}
}





191     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\exam\StudentView.java

package com.exam;

import java.util.List;

public class StudentView {
	public void viewStudent(Student st) {
		System.out.printf("%10s %5d %5d %5d\n", st.getName(), st.getAge(), st.getHeight(), st.getWeight());
	}

	public void viewStudentList(List<Student> list) {
		for (Student st : list) { // st∏¶ list∑Œ πﬁ∞⁄¥Ÿ.
			System.out.printf("%10s %5d %5d %5d\n", st.getName(), st.getAge(), st.getHeight(), st.getWeight());
		}
	}

}





192     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\test\MTest01.java

package com.test;

import java.util.*;

public class MTest01 {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Vector v = new Vector(); // 10∞≥πÊ¿Ã ª˝∞Â¥Ÿ !
		v.add("111"); // ∞¸∏Æ«œ¥¬ µ•¿Ã≈Õ ∏µŒ ¬¸¡∂«¸ (∞˝»£æ»ø° ovject e ∂ﬂ¿›æ∆ø© ?)
		v.add("222"); // ¥Ÿ new∂Û∞Ì ª˝∞¢«—¥Ÿ.
		v.add("333");
		v.add(null); // ∞°¥….
		v.add(null);
		System.out.println(v); // ∞¥√º∏¶ ª˝º∫«œ∏È ≥°ø° tostring¿Ã ∫Ÿ¥¬¥Ÿ.
		
		System.out.println(v.get(0));
		System.out.println(v.get(1));
		System.out.println(v.get(2));

		v.remove(2);
		System.out.println(v);

		v.set(0, "abc");
		System.out.println(v);

		System.out.println("∞≥ºˆ:" + v.size());
		System.out.println("øÎ∑Æ" + v.capacity());
		
		
//	Constructs an empty vector so that its internal data array has size 10 and its standard capacity increment is zero.
// πÊ 10∞≥¡ﬂø° 2∞≥ ¿⁄∑·,  size :2 / capacity 10
	}
}





193     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\test\MTest02.java

package com.test;

import java.util.*;

public class MTest02 {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Vector<Integer> v1 = new Vector<>(10, 10); // Vector(int initialCapacity, int capacityIncrement)
		// <Integer> ¬¸¡∂«¸ (class ∞¥√º∏∏∞¸∏Æ) ∏∏ ∞¸∏Æ«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ¥¬ generics.
		// ¥ÎªÛ¿ª ≥ª∞° ø¯«œ¥¬ ¥ÎªÛ¿∏∑Œ Ω…æÓº≠ ∫¸∏£∞Ì »ø¿≤¿˚¿∏∑Œ ∞¸∏Æ«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ∞° generics.
		// score∏∏ ≥÷¿∏∏È «œ¿ß ≈¨∑°Ω∫∏¶ ¥Ÿ ∞∞¿Ã ∞¸∏Æ«“ ºˆ ¿÷¥¬∞Õ. (score - Mid.Score & Final.S «œ¿ß≈¨∑°Ω∫)
		// ¿¸øÎ µ•¿Ã≈Õ ≈∏¿‘¿ª ∏∏µÈæ˙¥Ÿ. // score∏¶ ≥÷æÓº≠, mid,final ∞∞¿Ã ∞¸∏Æ«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ.
		for (int i = 0; i < 11; i++) {
			v1.add(i);
		}
// 		v1.add("abc");  : ¿ßø° generics <integer> ∂ßπÆø° æ»µ .
		// The method add(Integer) in the type Vector<Integer> is not applicable for the
		// arguments (String)
		v1.add(100); // generics º±æ »ƒ, v1. «œ∏È, ∞¸∑√ method∞° ∏µŒ integer∑Œ ∫Ø∞Êµ 

		System.out.println(v1);
		System.out.println("∞≥ºˆ: " + v1.size());
		System.out.println("øÎ∑Æ: " + v1.capacity()); // øÎ∑Æ¿∫ ¥ı∫Ì∑Œ ¥√æÓ≥≠¥Ÿ. 11->20 / 21 -> 40 / 41 -> 80 ∞≥∑Œ ¥√æÓ≥≤
													// π›µÂΩ√ capacity∏¶ √‚∑¬«ÿº≠ »Æ¿Œ «ÿæﬂ«‘.
	}

}





194     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\test\Mtest03.java

package com.test;
// √‚∑¬±∏πÆ

// º¬¥Ÿ ∂»∞∞¿∏¥œ±Ó ∆Ï«—∞≈ «œ≥™ «œΩ√∏È § §≤¥œ¥Ÿ.

import java.util.*;
import com.test.Score;

public class Mtest03 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		List<Score> vm = new Vector<Score>(); // object¿« ¿⁄Ωƒ¿ÃæÓæﬂ ø√ ºˆ ¿÷¿Ω (±‚∫ª¿⁄∑·«¸X), Score class∏∏ πﬁ∞⁄¥Ÿ. ππæﬂ ¿Ã∞‘?
		// List ∞¥√º πÿø° ¿÷¥¬ Vector.
		// if º±¡∂¿« ¡÷º“ π¯¡ˆ∑Œ πﬁ¿∏∏È, ¥Ÿ«¸º∫¿Œ∞°ø© ?
		//
		vm.add(new Score("»´±Êµø", 100, 100, 100));
		vm.add(new Score("¿Á¬˘¥‘", 50, 70, 35));
		vm.add(new Score("≥™∑°¥‘", 80, 90, 100));
		vm.add(new Score("√÷«¡∑Œ", 55, 98, 36));
		vm.add(new Score("µø∫Û¥‘", 50, 50, 45));

		prn(vm); // List
		// prn01(vm);
		// prn02(vm);
		System.out.println("1 ¿Á¬˘¥‘¿« ¿Ã∏ß¿ª øÏ∫Û¥‘¿∏∑Œ πŸ≤ŸæÓ ¿¸√º√‚∑¬");
		for (Score r : vm) {
			if (r.getName().trim().equals("¿Á¬˘¥‘")) {
				r.setName("±ËøÏ∫Û");
			}
		}
		System.out.println("¿Á¬˘¥‘-> ±ËøÏ∫Û ¿¸√º √‚∑¬");
		prn(vm);

		System.out.println("2 √÷«¡∑Œ¥‘¿« ±πæÓ ¡°ºˆ∏¶ 100¿∏∑Œ πŸ≤ŸæÓ ¿¸√º√‚∑¬");

		for (Score r : vm) {
			if (r.getName().trim().equals("√÷«¡∑Œ")) {
				r.setKor(100);
				;
			}
			System.out.println("√÷«¡∑Œ¥‘ ±πæÓ¡°ºˆ -> 100 ¿¸√º √‚∑¬");
			prn(vm);

			System.out.println("3 µø∫Û¥‘¿Ã ¿÷¥¬ ∞¥§∫¿« ºˆ«–¡°ºˆ∏¶ 100¿∏∑Œ ∫Ø∞Ê»ƒ, µø∫Û¥‘∏∏ √‚∑¬");

			for (Score a : vm) {
				if (a.getName().trim().equals("µø∫Û¥‘")) {
					a.setMat(100); //
					// ¿Ã set¿Ã∂˚ index set¿Ã∂˚ ¥Ÿ∏ß ?
					// set(index, E element) :
					// remove : ¿Œµ¶Ω∫∏¶ ¡ˆøˆπˆ∏≤.
					System.out.println(a);
				}

			}
			System.out.println("4 ≥™∑°¥‘¿« ¿Ã∏ß¿Ã µÈæÓ¿÷¥¬ ∞¥√º¿« ¿Œµ¶Ω∫∏¶ ±∏«ÿ∫∏¿⁄.");
			for (Score a : vm) {
				if (a.getName().trim().equals("≥™∑°¥‘")) {
					System.out.println(vm.indexOf(a) + "π¯¬∞");
				}
			}
			// set method ¡ﬂ¿Œµ•ø© , «ÿ¥Á elements ø‰º“∏¶ ∏Æ≈œ«œ¥¬ æ÷µÈ .
			/*remove
			public boolean remove(Object o)
			Removes the first occurrence of the specified element in this Vector If the Vector does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the element with the lowest index i such that (o==null ? get(i)==null : o.equals(get(i))) (if such an element exists).
			∫§≈Õ¿« ¡÷º“π¯¡ˆ∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ, ≥ª∞° æ∆¥œ∂Û.
			Returns:
			true if the Vector contained the specified element
			so, collection ∞¥√º¥¬, TF∏¶ ∫§≈Õ¿« ¡÷º“π¯¡ˆ∑Œ∏Æ≈œ«œ±‚ ¥ÎπÆø°, øÏ∏Æ∞° ±ª¿Ã πﬁ¿ª « ø‰∞° æ¯¥Ÿ ?
					void«¸Ωƒ√≥∑≥.
					vector T/F ∏Æ≈œ or set¿∏∑Œ ∞¥√º ∏Æ≈œ πﬁ¿ª ºˆ ¿÷¥Ÿ.
			
			*/
			/* // List int erface : Array list : ∏ÆΩ∫∆Æ¿« «œ¿ß∞¥√º (Resizable-array implementation of the List interface. Implements all optional list operations, and permits all elements, including null. In addition to implementing the List interface, this class provides methods to manipulate the size of the array that is used internally to store the list. (This class is roughly equivalent to Vector, except that it is unsynchronized.) 
			
			Vectorµµ Abstract list ªÛº” πﬁæ“¿Ω.
			All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<E>, Collection<E>, List<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractSequentialList, ArrayList, Vector

Array list - vector ∞∞¿∫ º±¡∂. ∞∞¿∫ method ªÁøÎ«œ∞Ì¿÷¿ª∞….
list∞° ªÁøÎ«œ¥¬ ∏π¿∫ method∏¶ §∂§©ºˆ¿÷¥¬∞« ¡ﬂ∞£ø° √ﬂªÛ≈¨∑°Ω∫∞° ¿÷æÓº≠.
collection ∞¥√º∞° æ¯¥¬ ∞ÕµÈ¿∫ √ﬂªÛ≈¨∑°Ω∫∞° ? π∫∏ª¿Œ¡ˆ∏∏£∞⁄¥Ÿ.

Class ArrayList<E>
   List list = Collections.synchronizedList(new ArrayList(...));
   
   ª˝º∫¿⁄∏¶ ∫∏∏È VectorøÕ∞˙ ¥Ÿ∏•∞≈.
    - capacityf∏¶ ¡ı∞°æ»µ 
    ArrayList(int initialCapacity) 
Constructs an empty list with the specified initial capacity. // √ ±‚∞™ ∏∏ ¡ˆ¡§«ÿ¡÷∞Ì, ºˆ¡§æ»µ .

    - method ∞≈¿« ∫ÒΩ¡ (CRUD)
    - 
			
			*/
			vm.remove(0);
			prn(vm);
			vm.set(1, new Score("111", 90, 70, 80));
			System.out.println("====>"+ r01); 
					
			prn(vm);
		}
	}

	public static void prn(List<Score> v) { // vector¿« score∏¶ πﬁ¥¬ method ª˝º∫
		System.out.println("Case 1 : for "); // for each : Ω√¿€¡÷º“π¯¡ˆ : «ÿ¥Á µ•¿Ã≈Õ≈∏¿‘ ∏Æ≈œ
		for (Score sm : v) {
			System.out.println(sm);
		}
	}

	public static void prn01(List<Score> rm) {
		System.out.println("Case 2 :for "); // ±◊≥… for
		for (int i = 0; i < rm.size(); i++) {
			System.out.println(rm.get(i));

		}
	}

	public static void prn02(List<Score> rm) {
		System.out.println("Case 3 : iterator"); // collection º±¡∂ interface∞° ∞Æ¥¬ method.
		// Iterator takes the place of Enumeration in the Java Collections Framework.
		// method : next() ≥™ø≠µ«æÓ¿÷¥¬ ¥ÎªÛ¿« method ∆˜¡ˆº«¿ª ¬Ô∞Ì, ¿–∞Ì ≥—∞‹¡÷∞Ì, ±◊ ¥Ÿ¿Ω¿∏∑Œ ≥—æÓ∞®. (point æ’¿ª
		// ¿–¥¬¥Ÿ.) false∏¶ ∏∏≥Ø∂ß±Ó¡ˆ (∏∂¡ˆ∏∑) ≥—æÓ∞¨¥Ÿ∞° ∏ÿ√„.
		// method : hasNext() // Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In
		// other words, returns true if next() would return an element rather than
		// throwing an exception.) // while ø° ≥÷¥¬∞‘ ∆Ì«’¥œ¥Ÿ.

		Iterator<Score> res = rm.iterator(); // ¿⁄±‚¿⁄Ω≈¿ª ∏Æ≈œ.
		while (res.hasNext()) {
			System.out.println(res.next());
		}

	}
}

package com.test;
 // √‚∑¬±∏πÆ
import java.util.*;
import com.test.Score;

public class Mtest031 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		Vector<Score> vm = new Vector<Score>(); // object¿« ¿⁄Ωƒ¿ÃæÓæﬂ ø√ ºˆ ¿÷¿Ω (±‚∫ª¿⁄∑·«¸X), Score class∏∏ πﬁ∞⁄¥Ÿ. ππæﬂ ¿Ã∞‘?
		// List ∞¥√º πÿø° ¿÷¥¬ Vector.
		// if º±¡∂¿« ¡÷º“ π¯¡ˆ∑Œ πﬁ¿∏∏È, ¥Ÿ«¸º∫¿Œ∞°ø© ?
		// 
		vm.add(new Score("»´±Êµø", 100, 100, 100));
		vm.add(new Score("¿Á¬˘¥‘", 50, 70, 35));
		vm.add(new Score("≥™∑°¥‘", 80, 90, 100));
		vm.add(new Score("√÷«¡∑Œ", 55, 98, 36));
		vm.add(new Score("µø∫Û¥‘", 50, 50, 45));

		prn(vm); // List
		prn01(vm);
		prn02(vm);
	}

	public static void prn(Vector<Score> v) { // vector¿« score∏¶ πﬁ¥¬ method ª˝º∫
		System.out.println("Case 1 : for "); // for each : Ω√¿€¡÷º“π¯¡ˆ : «ÿ¥Á µ•¿Ã≈Õ≈∏¿‘ ∏Æ≈œ
		for (Score sm : v) {
			System.out.println(sm);
		}
	}

	public static void prn01(Vector<Score> rm) {
		System.out.println("Case 2 :for "); // ±◊≥… for
		for (int i = 0; i < rm.size(); i++) {
			System.out.println(rm.get(i));

		}
	}

	public static void prn02(Vector<Score> rm) {
		System.out.println("Case 3 : iterator"); // collection º±¡∂ interface∞° ∞Æ¥¬ method.
		// Iterator takes the place of Enumeration in the Java Collections Framework.
		// method : next() ≥™ø≠µ«æÓ¿÷¥¬ ¥ÎªÛ¿« method ∆˜¡ˆº«¿ª ¬Ô∞Ì, ¿–∞Ì ≥—∞‹¡÷∞Ì, ±◊ ¥Ÿ¿Ω¿∏∑Œ ≥—æÓ∞®. (point æ’¿ª
		// ¿–¥¬¥Ÿ.) false∏¶ ∏∏≥Ø∂ß±Ó¡ˆ (∏∂¡ˆ∏∑) ≥—æÓ∞¨¥Ÿ∞° ∏ÿ√„.
		// method : hasNext() // Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next() would return an element rather than throwing an exception.) // while ø° ≥÷¥¬∞‘ ∆Ì«’¥œ¥Ÿ.
		
		Iterator<Score> res = rm.iterator(); // ¿⁄±‚¿⁄Ω≈¿ª ∏Æ≈œ.
		while (res.hasNext()) {
			System.out.println(res.next());
		}

	}
}

package com.test;
 // √‚∑¬±∏πÆ
import java.util.*;
import com.test.Score;

public class Mtest04 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		List<Score> vm = new ArrayList<>(); 
		// syncronized«œ∑¡∏È io , thread «ÿæﬂµ≈º≠ æ∆¡˜ ∏∏ß.
		// ¿⁄∑·∞¸∏Æ¥¬ list »ƒº’≈¨∑°Ω∫∂Ûº≠ CRUD∞° µø¿œ«œ¥Ÿ∏∏ æÀ∏Èµ .
		// ¡˜∑ƒ»≠øÕ threadøµ«‚ πﬁ≥™ æ»πﬁ≥™ ¬˜¿Ã

		vm.add(new Score("»´±Êµø", 100, 100, 100));
		vm.add(new Score("¿Á¬˘¥‘", 50, 70, 35));
		vm.add(new Score("≥™∑°¥‘", 80, 90, 100));
		vm.add(new Score("√÷«¡∑Œ", 55, 98, 36));
		vm.add(new Score("µø∫Û¥‘", 50, 50, 45));
		vm.add(null);

		prn(vm);
		//prn01(vm);
	//	prn02(vm);
	}

	public static void prn(List<Score> v) { 
		System.out.println("Case 1 : for ");
		for (Score sm : v) {
			System.out.println(sm);
		}
	}

	public static void prn01(Vector<Score> rm) {
		System.out.println("Case 2 :for ");
		for (int i = 0; i < rm.size(); i++) {
			System.out.println(rm.get(i));

		}
	}

	public static void prn02(Vector<Score> rm) {
		System.out.println("Case 3 : iterator"); 

		Iterator<Score> res = rm.iterator();
		while (res.hasNext()) {
			System.out.println(res.next());
		}

	}
}

package com.test;

import java.util.*;

public class MTest06 {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Set<Score> hs = new HashSet<>();
		hs.add(new Score("π⁄º∫æ∆", 20, 3, 89));
		hs.add(new Score("111", 80, 80, 80));
		hs.add(new Score("111", 80, 80, 80)); // ¡ﬂ∫πµ» ∞™ µ«¥¬µ•ø© ?
		hs.add(new Score("111", 90, 90, 90));
		hs.add(new Score("222", 90, 90, 90));
		hs.add(new Score("333", 10, 20, 30));

		// System.out.println(hs);
		// prn(hs);
		// prn01(hs);

		System.out.println("333¿« ¿Ã∏ß¿ª »´±Êµø¿∏∑Œ ∫Ø∞Ê«ÿ∫∏¿⁄.");
		for (Score s : hs) {
			if (s.getName().trim().equals("333")) {
				s.setName("»´±Êµø");
			} // if end
		} // for end
		prn(hs);

		System.out.println("222¿« ±πæÓ¡°ºˆ∏¶ 100¿∏∑Œ ∫Ø∞Ê«œ∞Ì, 222∏∏ √‚∑¬«ÿ∫∏¿⁄.");
		for (Score s : hs) {
			if (s.getName().trim().equals("222")) {
				s.setKor(100);
				System.out.println(s);
			} // if2 end
		} // for2 end
	} // main

	public static void prn(Set<Score> sm) {
		// generics for ¿ÃøÎ«ÿº≠ √‚∑¬«ÿ∫ª¥Ÿ.
		System.out.println("Case 1 : Generics for");
		for (Score s : sm) { // set¿Ã genericsfor ∞Æ∞Ì¿÷±‚∂ßπÆø° ∞°¥…. 
			// æ»±◊∑Ø∏È iterator∑Œ «œ∏È has Next ¥ÎªÛø° ∫Ø∞Ê«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ∞Ì
			System.out.println(s);
		} // prn for end
	} // prn end

	public static void prn01(Set<Score> sm) {
		/// iterator∏¶ ªÁøÎ«ÿ ∫ª¥Ÿ
		System.out.println("Case 2 : Iterator ");

		Iterator<Score> res = sm.iterator(); // ¿¸√º ∞¥√º∏¶ iterator∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ. sm¿Ã ∞Æ¥¬ µ•¿Ã≈Õ∏¶ iterator∞° ∫–«“«ÿº≠ resø° πﬁ¿Ω.

		while (res.hasNext()) { // ¥Ÿ πﬁ∞Ì ≥™∏È, res.hasNext¥¬ false∞° ∂Â¥œ¥Ÿ.
			System.out.println(res.next());
		} // prn while end
		System.out.println(res.hasNext() + ":" + sm.size());
	//	res.remove(); // file æ≤∞Ì ∏∂¡ˆ∏∑ø° ¥›¥¬ close √≥∑≥ æ¥¥Ÿ. ≥™¡ﬂø° Garbage collector∞° √≥∏Æ«œ±‚∂ßπÆø° æ»Ω·µµ µ«±‰«’¥œ¥Ÿ.
	}// prn01 end
	
	public static void prn02(Set<Score> sm) { // ??????????? ø©±‚º≥∏Ì¿∫¿ﬂ∏¯µÈæ˙¿Ω §–§–
	Iterator <Score> r = sm.iterator(); // ¡ﬂ√∏ for ∫∏¥Ÿ iterator∞° ∆Ì«“∂ß∞° ¿÷¥‰¥œ¥Ÿ.
	while(r.hasNext()) { // for(; r.hasNext();) {}   √ ±‚∞™ « ø‰æ¯∞Ì, ¡ı∞®Ωƒ æ¯∞Ì. 
 		 Score s = r.next(); // ø©±‚º≠ ∏Æ≈œ∞™¿ª πﬁæ∆¡‡æﬂ«‘.
 		 if(s.getName().trim().equals("222")) {
 			 s.setEng(50);
 		 } 
	}
	
	
	}

} // class end





199     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\test01\HTest01.java

package com.test01;

import java.util.*;

public class HTest01 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// ∞¥√ºª˝º∫ //
		// put¿∏∑Œ ≥÷¥¬¥Ÿ.
		HashMap<Integer, String> hm = new HashMap<>();
		Calendar today = Calendar.getInstance();
		System.out.println(today);
		hm.put(1, "¿œø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(2, "ø˘ø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(3, "»≠ø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(4, "ºˆø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(4, "∏Òø‰¿œ"); // key ¡ﬂ∫π, value ¡ﬂ∫π æ∆¥œ∏È ? value¥¬ ∏∂¡ˆ∏∑ø° ≥÷¿∫∞‘ ≥™ø».
		hm.put(5, "∏Òø‰¿œ"); // value ¡ﬂ∫πµµ ±¶¬˙¿Ω
		hm.put(null, "±›ø‰¿œ"); // key∞™ø° null ¡÷∏È ≥™¡ﬂ§∑ §ƒ∫Ò±≥∞° æ»µ≈º≠ error≥Øºˆ¿÷¿Ω.
		hm.put(null, "≈‰ø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(7, null);
		hm.put(8, null);

		System.out.println(hm);
		System.out.println("¿¸√º√‚∑¬");
		prn(hm);
		System.out.println("≈∞∞™∏∏ √‚∑¬");
		prn_key(hm);
		System.out.println("∞™∏∏ √‚∑¬");
		prn_V(hm);
		System.out.println("≈∞∞™¿Ã 1¿Ã ¿÷≥™ »Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsKey(1));
		System.out.println("Valueø° ø˘ø‰¿œ¿Ã¿÷≥™»Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsValue("ø˘ø‰¿œ"));
		System.out.println("≈∞∞™¿Ã null¿Ã ¿÷≥™ »Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsKey(null));
		System.out.println("Valueø° nul¿Ã¿÷≥™»Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsValue(null));
		// ±‚∫ª¿˚¿∏∑Œ null¿∫ ∞¥√º∏¶ √ ±‚»≠Ω√ƒ—¡÷¥¬ ø™«“. key ∞™ø° null ¡÷∏È æ»µ .
		//elements∏¶ √£∞Ì ¿÷Ω¿¥œ¥Ÿ
	} // main end

	public static void prn(HashMap<Integer, String> rm) {
		System.out.println("For Loop"); // generics for¥¬ ∏Æ≈œ«œ¥¬ type∏∏ æÀ∏È Ω±¥Ÿ. key ∞™∏Æ≈œ keyset / key∏¶ ∞Æ¥Ÿ∞° value πﬁ¥¬∞‘
										// getreturn.
		for (Integer key : rm.keySet()) // 1 => ø˘ø‰¿œ keyset¿ª generics for∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ
		{
			System.out.println(key + " =>" + rm.get(key)); // key∏¶ ∏’¿˙ πﬁæ∆ø¿¥¬∞‘ ∆Ì«œ¥Ÿ.
		}
	}// prn end

	public static void prn_key(HashMap<Integer, String> rm) {

		Set<Integer> res = rm.keySet(); // set¿« ∞¥√º∑Œ key∞™¿ª ∏Æ≈œ. key∞™¿Ã¥œ±Ó Interger∞°ø¬¥Ÿ.
		Iterator<Integer> ir = res.iterator(); // HashSet¿∫
		while (ir.hasNext()) {
			System.out.println(ir.next());
		}
	} // prnkey end

	public static void prn_V(HashMap<Integer,String> rm) {
		// hashmap ∞¥√º∞° ∞Æ¥¬∞Õ¡ﬂø° values∏∏ √ﬂ√‚«ÿ∞Æ∞Ìø…¥œ¥Ÿ.
		//
Collection <String> col = rm.values(); // s∞°¿÷§∑∏È collection, æ¯¿∏∏È interface ?
Iterator <String> ir = col.iterator();  // ∏µÁ∞¥√º∞° iterator∏¶∞Æ∞Ì¿÷¥Ÿ ?
while (ir.hasNext()) {

	System.out.println(ir.next());}
} // prn_V end
	
	
} // class end





200     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\test01\HTest011.java

package com.test01;

import java.util.*;

public class HTest011 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// ∞¥√ºª˝º∫ //
		// put¿∏∑Œ ≥÷¥¬¥Ÿ.
		Map<Integer, String> hm = new HashMap<>();
		Calendar today = Calendar.getInstance();
		System.out.println(today);
		hm.put(1, "¿œø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(2, "ø˘ø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(3, "»≠ø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(4, "ºˆø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(4, "∏Òø‰¿œ"); // key ¡ﬂ∫π, value ¡ﬂ∫π æ∆¥œ∏È ? value¥¬ ∏∂¡ˆ∏∑ø° ≥÷¿∫∞‘ ≥™ø».
		hm.put(5, "∏Òø‰¿œ"); // value ¡ﬂ∫πµµ ±¶¬˙¿Ω
		hm.put(null, "±›ø‰¿œ"); // key∞™ø° null ¡÷∏È ≥™¡ﬂ§∑ §ƒ∫Ò±≥∞° æ»µ≈º≠ error≥Øºˆ¿÷¿Ω.
		hm.put(null, "≈‰ø‰¿œ");
		hm.put(7, null);
		hm.put(8, null);

		System.out.println(hm);
		System.out.println("¿¸√º√‚∑¬");
		prn(hm);
		System.out.println("≈∞∞™∏∏ √‚∑¬");
		prn_key(hm);
		System.out.println("∞™∏∏ √‚∑¬");
		prn_V(hm);
		System.out.println("≈∞∞™¿Ã 1¿Ã ¿÷≥™ »Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsKey(1));
		System.out.println("Valueø° ø˘ø‰¿œ¿Ã¿÷≥™»Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsValue("ø˘ø‰¿œ"));
		System.out.println("≈∞∞™¿Ã null¿Ã ¿÷≥™ »Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsKey(null));
		System.out.println("Valueø° nul¿Ã¿÷≥™»Æ¿Œ"+hm.containsValue(null));
		// ±‚∫ª¿˚¿∏∑Œ null¿∫ ∞¥√º∏¶ √ ±‚»≠Ω√ƒ—¡÷¥¬ ø™«“. key ∞™ø° null ¡÷∏È æ»µ .
		//elements∏¶ √£∞Ì ¿÷Ω¿¥œ¥Ÿ
	} // main end

	public static void prn(Map<Integer, String> rm) {
		System.out.println("For Loop"); // generics for¥¬ ∏Æ≈œ«œ¥¬ type∏∏ æÀ∏È Ω±¥Ÿ. key ∞™∏Æ≈œ keyset / key∏¶ ∞Æ¥Ÿ∞° value πﬁ¥¬∞‘
										// getreturn.
		for (Integer key : rm.keySet()) // 1 => ø˘ø‰¿œ keyset¿ª generics for∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ
		{
			System.out.println(key + " =>" + rm.get(key)); // key∏¶ ∏’¿˙ πﬁæ∆ø¿¥¬∞‘ ∆Ì«œ¥Ÿ.
		}
	}// prn end

	public static void prn_key(Map<Integer, String> rm) {

		Set<Integer> res = rm.keySet(); // set¿« ∞¥√º∑Œ key∞™¿ª ∏Æ≈œ. key∞™¿Ã¥œ±Ó Interger∞°ø¬¥Ÿ.
		Iterator<Integer> ir = res.iterator(); // HashSet¿∫
		while (ir.hasNext()) {
			System.out.println(ir.next());
		}
	} // prnkey end

	public static void prn_V(Map<Integer,String> rm) {
		// hashmap ∞¥√º∞° ∞Æ¥¬∞Õ¡ﬂø° values∏∏ √ﬂ√‚«ÿ∞Æ∞Ìø…¥œ¥Ÿ.
		//
Collection <String> col = rm.values(); // s∞°¿÷§∑∏È collection, æ¯¿∏∏È interface ?
Iterator <String> ir = col.iterator();  // ∏µÁ∞¥√º∞° iterator∏¶∞Æ∞Ì¿÷¥Ÿ ?
while (ir.hasNext()) {

	System.out.println(ir.next());}
} // prn_V end
	
	
} // class end





201     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY19\src\com\test01\HTest02.java

package com.test01;

import java.util.*;
import java.util.Map.Entry;

import com.test.Address;

public class HTest02 {

	public static void main(String[] args) {

		Map<Integer, Address> hm = new HashMap<>();
		hm.put(1, new Address("111", "111", "111"));
		hm.put(2, new Address("222", "222", "222"));
		hm.put(3, new Address("333", "333", "333"));

		System.out.println("¿¸√º√‚∑¬");
		prn_View(hm);

	}

	private static void prn_View(Map<Integer, Address> hm) { //// ≥ª∞°πª«œ∞Ì¿÷¥¬∞«¡ˆ∏∏£∞⁄¥Ÿ. ¥Ÿ«¸º∫¿« »∞øÎ¿Œµ•π∫¡ˆ∏∏£∞⁄¥Ÿ. -_-
		// Set<Map.entry <k,v>>
		Set<Map.Entry<Integer, Address>> my_set = hm.entrySet();
		Iterator<Entry<Integer, Address>> ir = my_set.iterator(); // ø¨º”¿∏∑Œ µ•¿Ã≈Õ∏¶ ¿–¿ª ºˆ ¿÷¥¬ ∏ﬁº“µÂ iterator
		// ir¿∫ key value∏¶ «œ≥™¿« record∑Œ ∞¸∏Æ.¿Ã∞… next∑Œ ¿–∞Ì ∆˜¡ˆº«¡ˆ≥™∞®.
		// key∏¶ ¿–∞Ì(1) ≥ª∑¡∞°. next¥œ±Ó, next¥¬ «œ≥™¿« record∏¶ ¿–¥¬¥Ÿ. nextø° ¿÷¥¬ value∏¶ ¿–∞Ì, nextø° ¿÷§§§§
		// key∏¶ ¿–¥¬¥Ÿ.
		// ir.next «œ∏È, return∞™¿Ã record. ±◊∞…∫∏∞Ì Entry<k,v> ¿Ã∞…«—Ω÷¿∏∑Œ∫∏∞Ì, res¿Ã∏ß¿∏∑Œ key§§§§ ¿Œ∆º¿˙
		// value¥¬ address∑Œ¢Z¥Ÿ.
		// ¿Ã∞‘ res.key, res.value∑Œ ∫≠«—¥Ÿ ?

		while (ir.hasNext()) {
			Entry<Integer, Address> e = ir.next();

			System.out.println(ir.next().getKey() + ":" + ir.next().getValue());
		}

//		 Mapæ»ø°¿÷¥¬ æ÷µÈ¿ª entry∂Û¥¬ ∞¥√ºø° π≠ø©º≠ setø° µÈæÓ∞®.  ππ¡ˆ ∏∏£∞⁄¥Ÿ.
		// iterator∑Œ π≠ø©º≠ µÈæÓ∞•∞Õ.
		/*
		 * Set<Map.Entry<K,V>> entrySet() Returns a Set view of the mappings contained
		 * in this map. - V getValue() Returns the value corresponding to this entry.
		 * 
		 * 
		 */
	}// prn v end
}





202     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY20\src\com\test\Emp.java

package com.test;

public class Emp<T> {

	private String e_name ;
	private  T emp_no ;

	public Emp() {
		super();
		// TODO Auto-generated constructor stub
	}
	
	public Emp(String e_name, T emp_no) {
		super();
		this.e_name = e_name;
		this.emp_no = emp_no;
	}


	public String getE_name() {
		return e_name;
	}

	public void setE_name(String e_name) {
		this.e_name = e_name;
	}

	public T getEmp_no() {
		return emp_no;
	}

	public void setEmp_no(T emp_no) {
		this.emp_no = emp_no;
	}

	@Override
	public String toString() {
		return "Emp [e_name=" + e_name + ", emp_no=" + emp_no + "]";
	}
	
	
	
	
}

package com.test;

import java.util.Arrays;

public class EmpTest {

	@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		@SuppressWarnings("unchecked") // generics ≈∏¿‘º±æ«ÿæﬂµ»¥¿µ• æ»µ≈¿÷æÓº≠ ∂‰
		Emp e1 = new Emp("»´±Êµø", "aaa111");
		Emp e2 = new Emp("¡§±Êµø", 222); // String type --> Integer∑Œ πŸ≤Ò.
		// private T emp_no ; ∫Øºˆ∏¶ Stringø°º≠ ∑Œ ∫Ø∞Ê & ª˝º∫¿⁄ , getter setter ¿¸∫Œ T∑Œ ∫Ø∞Ê«ÿ¡÷æÓæﬂ«‘.
		// T means emp_no¥¬ æ∆π´≈∏¿‘¿Ã≥™ ±¶¬˙¥Ÿ¥¬ ∂Ê.
		System.out.println(e1);
		System.out.println(e2);

		Emp e3 = new Emp("π⁄±Êµø", 90.9);
		System.out.println(e3.getEmp_no());

		/*
		 * java.lang Interface Comparable<T> compareTo(T o) Compares this object with
		 * the specified object for order. µ¸«œ≥™¿÷¥¬ method. this.objectøÕ ≥—æÓø¿¥¬ object∏¶ ∫Ò±≥. a
		 * negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than,
		 * equal to, or greater than the specified object. æˆ√ª∏π¿∫ »ƒº’ classµÈ¿Ã ¿Á¡§¿«. ±◊¡ﬂø° «œ≥™∞°
		 * ƒ≥∏Ø≈Õ. character¿« method compareTo(Character anotherCharacter) Compares two
		 * Character objects numerically.
		 * 
		 * public int compareTo(Character anotherCharacter) Compares two Character
		 * objects numerically. Specified by: compareTo in interface
		 * Comparable<Character>
		 * 
		 * public static int compare(char x, char y) Compares two char values
		 * numerically. The value returned is identical to what would be returned by:
		 * Character.valueOf(x).compareTo(Character.valueOf(y))
		 */
		System.out.println(Character.compare('A', 'C'));
		System.out.println(Character.compare('E', 'B'));

		Character c1 = new Character('A');
		Character c2 = new Character('C');

		System.out.println(c1.compareTo(c2));

		// æˆ√ª∏π¿∫ »ƒº’ classµÈ¿Ã ¿Á¡§¿«.
//	 ±◊¡ﬂø° «œ≥™∞°  ∂« STring
		// compareTo(String anotherString)
		// Compares two strings lexicographically.

		// a 65 vs A 97 // 1 =49, 0=48
		System.out.println("abcde".compareTo("abcde"));
		System.out.println("Abcde".compareTo("abcde")); // a 65 vs A 97 // 1 =49, 0=48
		System.out.println("aBcde".compareTo("abcde")); // bøÕ B∞° 32¬˜¿Ã∞° ≥≠¥Ÿ. // aøÕ A∞° 32 ¬˜¿Ã≥™µÌ¿Ã.
		// √ππ¯¬∞∫Œ≈Õ ≈©¥Ÿ¿€¥Ÿ ∫Ò±≥«œ±‚∂ßπÆø° ∏’¿˙ ∆≤∏Æ∏È ±◊µ⁄ø£ ∫Ò±≥æ»«œ∞Ì ∞™¿ª ∏Æ≈œ«—¥Ÿ.
		System.out.println("aBCde".compareTo("abcde"));

		/*
		 * java.util Class Arrays : «ÿ¥Á char,
		 * 
		 * ø¿¥√ºˆæ˜¿Ãππ≥ƒ∏Èº≈ util collectio ∞¥√ºæ÷µÈ list set map¿ª ¿Ø¿˙∞° ∏æ¥Î∑Œ ¡§∑ƒ, §µ«√«œ∑¡∏È methodø°¥Î«ÿæÀæ∆æﬂ
		 * ≥™¡ﬂø° æÍ≥◊∞°∞Æ¥¬ ∏≈∞≥¿Œ¿⁄∏¶¿Ã«ÿ«œ∏Èº≠ type, generics , ? super C ío∏Æ§√§§∞≈«œ∞Ì¿÷Ω¿¥œ¥Ÿ. <> æ»ø° º±æ«œ¥¬∞≈,
		 * æÓ∂≤µ•¿Ã≈Õø¿¥¬¡ˆæÀ∞Ì¿÷¥¬µ• ¿Ã∑±æ÷µÈ¿Ã §∑¥œ≈Õ∆‰¿ÃΩ∫ ∏∏≥™∏ÈæÓ∂ª∞‘«“¡¸∏£¥œ±Ó »∞øÎ«œ∞Ì¿÷¥¬∞≈∫Û¥Ÿ.
		 */
		String[] str = { "abcde", "f11111", "b11111", "c11111", "d11111", "a1111" };
		System.out.println(str); // [Ljava.lang.String;@15db9742 πËø≠¿Ã ∞¥√ºø©º≠ toString override æ»«ﬂ¥Ÿ.

		prn(str);

		Arrays.sort(str); // ¡§∑ƒ
		prn(str);

	} // end main

	public static void prn(String[] r) {
		for (String s : r) // String¿∏∑Œ ∏Æ≈œπﬁ¥¬ s¿Œµ• r¿« ¡÷º“∑Œ
		{
			System.out.printf("%10s", s);
		}
		System.out.println();
	} // end prn

} // end class

public class MTest01 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		String str = "abcd";
		// ¿Ã∞… ∞°¡Æ¥Ÿ∞° method »∞øÎ¿ª«œ¥¬µ•, ¿¸∫Œ ∫Ø»Øƒ⁄µÂ (¿⁄±‚¿⁄Ω≈«—≈◊ «ÿ¥Á¿Œµ¶Ω∫∏¶±∏«ÿº≠ ¥Ÿ∏•≈∏¿‘¿∏∑Œ∏Æ≈œ, ∫πªÁ«ÿº≠ ∏Æ≈œ, µÓµÓµÓ ) .

		System.out.println(str02);

		// but String buffer¥¬ πŸ≤Ò.

		StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
		sb.append("abc");
		System.out.println(sb);
		sb.append("def");
		System.out.println(sb); // ¿Ã∞Õ∫¡, πŸ≤Ò.
		sb.insert(1, "1111111"); // 1π¯¡ˆø° ≥÷æÓ∂Û.
		System.out.println(sb);
		System.out.println(sb + "," + sb.length() + "," + sb.capacity());
		/// Buffer¥¬ upper∞° æ¯¿Ω. String class∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ«œø© ∫Ø∞Ê«ÿæﬂ«‘ .
		System.out.println(sb.toString());
		String str03 = new String(sb);
		System.out.println(str03.toUpperCase());
		System.out.println(str03);
		System.out.println(sb);

		
		// Builder¥¬ Buffer∂˚ §®∞Ì∞∞¿Ã æ≤¥¬µ• µø±‚»≠¿« ¬˜¿Ã.
		StringBuilder sv = new StringBuilder();
		sv.append("abc");
		System.out.println(sv);
		sv.append("def");
		System.out.println(sv); 
		sv.insert(1, "2222222"); 
		System.out.println(sv);
		System.out.println(sv + "," + sv.length() + "," + sv.capacity());
	}
	
	// join(CharSequence delimiter, CharSequence... elements) 
//	Returns a new String composed of copies of the CharSequence elements joined together with a copy of the specified delimiter.
// String / Stringbuilder / StringBuffer ¥Ÿ ø√ ºˆ ¿÷¿Ω. ¥Ÿ«¸º∫¿Ã±‚ ∂ßπÆ.

205     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY20\src\com\test01\My.java

package com.test01;

public class My implements Comparable {

	private String name;
	private int age;

	@Override
	public String toString() {
		return "My [name=" + name + ", age=" + age + "]";
	}

	public String getName() {
		return name;
	}

	public void setName(String name) {
		this.name = name;
	}

	public int getAge() {
		return age;
	}

	public void setAge(int age) {
		this.age = age;
	}

	public My() {
		super();

	}

	public My(String name, int age) {
		super();
		this.name = name;
		this.age = age;
	}

	@Override
	public int compareTo(Object obj) {
		My res = (My) obj; // ∫Ò±≥«“ ∞¥√º
		/*
		if (this.getAge() > res.getAge()) {
			System.out.println(this.getAge() + ">" + res.getAge());
			return 1;
		} else if (this.getAge() < res.getAge()) {
			System.out.println(this.getAge() + "<" + res.getAge());
			return -1;
		} //¿Ã∞« ≥™¿Ã∑Œ ∫Ò±≥ ±◊∑≥ ¿Ã∏ß¿∏∑Œ ∫Ò±≥«ÿ∫∏¿⁄.
		*/
		
		if (this.getName().compareTo(res.getName()) > 0) {
			System.out.println(this.getName() + ">" + res.getName());
			return 1;
		} else if (this.getName().compareTo(res.getName()) < 0) {
			System.out.println(this.getName() + "<" + res.getName());
			return -1;
		}

		return 0;
	}
}





206     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY20\src\com\test01\MyTest.java

package com.test01;

import java.util.Arrays;

public class MyTest {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		My[] m = { new My("CCC", 25), new My("VVV", 20), new My("AAA", 53) };
// SORT«“∂ß, 0π¯¡ˆ 1π¯¡ˆ ≈©±‚∫Ò±≥«œ∞Ì, ∫Ò±≥«œ∞Ì≥≤¿∫∞… 2π¯¡ˆ ∞¥√º∂˚ ∫Ò±≥«œ∞Ì ¿Ã∑±Ωƒ¿∏∑Œ ≥°±Ó¡ˆ∞®.
// object∑Œ «œ≥™æø ≥—æÓ∞°¥œ±Ó, ¥ŸøÓƒ≥Ω∫∆√¿ª«ÿæﬂ«—¥Ÿ. My res = (My) obj; My override «ÿ¡÷ººø©.
		prn(m);
		Arrays.sort(m);
	/*	Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassCastException: com.test01.
	 * My cannot be cast to java.lang.Comparable 
	 * (∞™¿ª ∫Ò±≥«“ ¥ÎªÛ¿Ã æ¯¥Ÿ¥¬∞≈ø°ø‰.¥Ÿ∏•æ÷µÈ¿∫ implements πﬁæ∆º≠«—∞≈¥œ±Ó. øÏ∏Æµµ πﬁæ∆æﬂ¡ˆ)
	 * java.comparable∏¶ implements «—¥Ÿ. or innerclass∑Œ ≥÷¥¬¥Ÿ.
	 *  ±◊≥…«œ∏È, ¡§∑ƒ¿Ãæ»µ . implements«—¥Ÿ¿Ωø° compareto∏¶ ¿Á¡§¿« «œº≈æﬂ¡“.
	 *  
		at java.util.ComparableTimSort.countRunAndMakeAscending(Unknown Source)
		at java.util.ComparableTimSort.sort(Unknown Source)
		at java.util.Arrays.sort(Unknown Source)
		at com.test01.MyTest.main(MyTest.java:11) */
		
		prn(m);

	}

	public static void prn(My[] r) {
		for (My res : r) {
			System.out.println(res);
		}
		System.out.println("--------------------------");
	}
}

		File i = new File("c:\\MyTest\\πË±∏");
		File l = new File("c:\\MyTest\\æﬂ±∏\\≥Û±∏");
		File e = new File("c:\\MyTest\\πË±∏\\a.txt");

		f.mkdir();
		i.mkdir();
		l.mkdir();
		e.mkdir();
		
		try {
			e.createNewFile();
		} catch (IOException e1) {

		}
	}
}

package com.test;

		File fi = new File("c:\\MyTest\\πË±∏\\a.txt");
		File fi_1 = new File("c:\\\\MyTest02\\AA\\a.txt");
		fi.renameTo(fi_1);
// f.renameto(new File("c:\\MyTest02\\AA\\a.txt"));
		System.out.println("2. MyTest\\πË±∏∏¶ ªË¡¶");
		File fi02 = new File("c:\\MyTest\\πË±∏");
		fi02.delete();

		System.out.println("3. MyTest\\æﬂ±∏\\≥Û±∏ -> √‡±∏∑Œ ¿Ã∏ß ∫Ø∞Ê");
		File fi03 = new File("c:\\MyTest\\æﬂ±∏\\≥Û±∏");
		File fi03_1 = new File("c:\\MyTest\\æﬂ±∏\\√‡±∏");

211     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test\Mtest04.java

package com.test;

import java.io.*;

public class Mtest04 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// List∏Ò∑œ¿ª ªÏ∆Ï∫∏¥¬µ•, ¥ÎªÛ dir¿Ã∞Æ∞Ì¿÷¥¬∆ƒ¿œ µÓ¿« ∏Ò∑œ

		/*
		 * list() Returns an array of strings naming the files and directories in the
		 * directory denoted by this abstract pathname. listFiles() Returns an array of
		 * abstract pathnames denoting the files in the directory denoted by this
		 * abstract pathname.
		 * 
		 * isDirectory() Tests whether the file denoted by this abstract pathname is a
		 * directory.
		 * 
		 * isFile() Tests whether the file denoted by this abstract pathname is a normal
		 * file.
		 */

		File fi = new File("c:\\Windows\\System32");
		prn(fi);
		prn02(fi);

	}

	public static void prn(File fi) {
		// ¥ÎªÛ¿Ã∞Æ∞Ì¿÷¥¬∞ÕµÈ¿ª πËø≠∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ
//		∏Æ≈œ¿Ã Ω∫∆Æ∏µπËø≠¿Ã¥œ±Ó generic return¿∏∑Œ πﬁæ∆º≠ ∏Ò∑œ¿∏∑Œ 

		System.out.println("list()");
		for (String m_list : fi.list()) {
			System.out.println(m_list);
		}

	}

	public static void prn02(File fi) {
		// public File[] listFiles()
		// list files∂Û¥¬ ∞Õ¿ª ∏Æ≈œ.
		// non static¿Ã∂Ûº≠ fi∞°∏Æ≈œ«œ¥¬∞Õ¿Ã, list files ∆ƒ¿œ¿« πËø≠∑Œ ∏Æ≈Õπﬁ¥¬¥Ÿ. ?
		// file¿Ã∏ß¿ª æÍ¥¬ ∆ƒ¿œ¿« ∞¥√º∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ¿ª«œ¥œ±Ó, non static¿Œ method∏¶¥Ÿæµºˆ¿÷¥¬∞≈ø°ø‰. ?
		//
//		∆ƒ¿œ¿« πËø≠∑Œ ∏Æ≈Õ πﬁ∞⁄¥Ÿ = fi.listFiles()

//	¡¶≥◊∏ØΩ∫∆˜∏¶¿ÃøÎ«œ≥™æø∏Æ≈œπﬁ¿⁄.
		// ¿ßø°∞≈¥¬ ¿Ã∏ß∏∏∏Æ≈œ, æÍ¥¬ file¿« ∞¥√º∑Œ «œ∏È æ∆∏∂ to String ∏Æ≈œ«œ¥œ±Ó ∞Ê∑Œ±Ó¡ˆ ≥™ø√∞Õ.

//	File[] res = fi.listFiles();
//	for(File m_list : res) {
		// System.out.println(m_list); // ¿œπ›¿˚¿Œ ¡÷º“∏¶ ∏Æ≈œ«œ¥¬ toString¿Ã ≥™ø√∞Õ

		// toString override µ∆≥™ »Æ¿Œ«ÿ∫∏¿⁄.
		// public String toString()
//		Returns the pathname string of this abstract pathname. This is just the string returned by the getPath() method.
		File[] res = fi.listFiles();
		int fc = 0;
		int dc = 0;
		for (File m_list : res) {
			// System.out.println("getPath(): "+ m_list.getPath());
			// toString = getPath ∞° ∞∞¥Ÿ∞Ì«ﬂ¿›æ∆ø© ?
			// System.out.println("getAbsolutePath(): "+ m_list.getAbsolutePath());
			// System.out.println("getParent(): "+ m_list.getParent());
			// System.out.println("getName(): "+ m_list.getName());

			if (m_list.isFile()) {
				System.out.println("File name : " + m_list);
				fc++;

			} // if
			if (m_list.isDirectory()) {
				System.out.println("Directory name: " + m_list);
				System.out.println();
				dc++;
			} // if

			//
		} // for
		System.out.println("File count :" + fc);
		System.out.println("Dir count: " + dc);

	}// method

}// class





212     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test\MTest05.java

package com.test;

import java.io.*;

public class MTest05 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		File fi = new File("c:\\MyTest");
		View(fi); // ∆ƒ¿œ¿ª πﬁ¥¬æ÷ // ¿Á±Õ∏ﬁº“µÂ ? ¿Ã∞‘π∫¡ˆ∏∏£∞⁄§µïï¥Ÿ¥„§§ ¿∏«„«Î 
	}

	public static int cnt = 0;

	public static void View(File fi) { // ∆ƒ¿œ∞¥√º∏¶ πﬁ¥¬æ÷ -->
///		for (String str : fi.list()) { // fi¿« list∏∏ πÆ¿⁄ø≠∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ, πÿø° dir¥¬ ≈Ωªˆ ∫“∞°. «œ¿ß∞¥√º∏¶ πﬁ¿∏∏È, ≈Ωªˆ«œ¥¬ method∞° ¿÷æ˙¡ˆ. exists.
		// System.out.println(str);
		// }
		// int cnt = 0;// ø©±‚ static¿∏∑Œ º±æ«œ∑¡∏È, ¿¸ø™∫Øºˆ∑Œ ¡‡æﬂ«‘ (pulic static int∑Œ ¡‡æﬂµ ) static¿∫
		// class æ»ø° º±æµ«¥¬ ∞¯øÎ∫Øºˆ
		System.out.println(++cnt + "============= cnt∞° ∏Óπ¯»£√‚µ«≥™" + fi.getName());
		if (fi.exists() && fi != null) {
			for (File str : fi.listFiles()) {
//∆ƒ¿œ¿« πËø≠∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ«œ¥¬æ÷¥œ±Ó, 0π¯¡ˆ[æﬂ±∏], 1π¯¡ˆ[πË±∏] - 0π¯¡ˆ æﬂ±∏∏¶ πﬁæ∆º≠ ¥ŸΩ√ ¿⁄±‚¿⁄Ω≈¿ª ∫“∑Ø. ifπÆ  if æﬂ±∏∞° ¡∏¿Á«œ∏È, fi list files æﬂ±∏ πÿø°¿÷¥¬ ≥Û±∏∏¶ for ∑Œ ∏Æ≈œ.  ±◊∑Ø¥Ÿ ≥™¡ﬂø° æ¯¿∏∏È, ∏Æ≈œ = method¡æ∑·(≥Û±∏¬˘¥¯∏ﬁº“µÂ) , ¡æ∑·(æﬂ±∏√£¥¯), ¡æ∑·(mytest)µ«∞Ì≥™º≠ ≥° 
				System.out.println(str);
				View(str); // ≥™¥¬ «ÿ¥Á str¿ª πﬁæ∆º≠ ∞¥√º∏¶ ∏Æ≈œ«œ¥¬æ÷¥œ±Ó, ≥ª∞° ≥™∏¶ ∫Œ∏£¥¬ ¿Á±Õ∞° ∞°¥…. ±◊∑≥, π´«—∑Á«¡∞° µ«±‚ ∂ßπÆø° ifπÆ¿Ã « ø‰

			} // ∆ƒ¿œ¿÷¿∏∏È, depthæ¯æÓº≠ null point exception¿Ã ≥™¥œ±Ó, if, directory∏∏«œ∞ÌΩÕ¿∏∏È ¥ÎªÛdirectory
				// fi∞° null¿Ã æ∆¥“∂ß, ∂Û∞Ì ¡∂∞«¿ª «œ≥™ ¥ı¡‹ or text ∆ƒ¿œ¿ª ¡ˆøˆ∂Û.
		} else {
			return;
		}
	}

}


/*

¿œπ›¿˚¿∏∑Œ ∆ƒ¿œø¿∏•¬ ∏∂øÏΩ∫µÈæÓ∞°º≠º”º∫µÈæÓ∞°º≠ ≥™ø¿¥¬ ∏µÁ §ø¿œ¡§∫∏∏¶ file class ∏ﬁº“µÂ∑Œ ¥Ÿ ∞Æ∞Ìø√ºˆ¿÷¥Ÿ.

±◊¿ßø£∫∞∞≈æ¯¥Ÿ.

±◊¥Ÿ¿Ωø° ∏∏∏∏«— file ¿–∞Ìæ≤¥¬∞Õ. - Ω·æﬂ ¿–¥¬¥Ÿ. write ∏’¿˙.
Class FileWriter
º±¡∂∞°¥©±∏≥ƒ : 	java.io.OutputStreamWriter 
char ¥‹¿ß∏È, writer // 
ª˝º∫¿⁄ : 
method : ∫ª¿Œ method æ¯æÓº≠ ±◊≥… write∏¶æ¥¥Ÿ.

213     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test\MTest06.java

package com.test;
import java.io.*;
//∆ƒ¿œ ¿‘√‚∑¬¿ª «ÿ∫∏∞⁄∂Â¥œ¥Ÿ.
public class MTest06 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
	File fi = new File("a.txt") ;	// "." : «ˆ¿Á µ∑∫≈‰∏Æø°¥Ÿ∞° ∆ƒ¿œ¿ª ª˝º∫«œø© ±∏ø¨«œ∞⁄¥Ÿ.
	// "." æ¯¿∏∏È, Day21 æ∆∑°ø° ª˝±È¥œ¥Ÿ.
	FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(fi);
	fw.write("æˆ∏∂æˆ∏∂\n");
	fw.write("æ∆∫¸æ∆∫¸ \t");
	fw.write("π⁄¿Œæ∆µ≈¡ˆ \n");

	fw.close();
	
	// ΩË¿∏∏È ¿–¿⁄.
	// FileReader : ∫ª¿Œ Methodæ¯¿Ω - readæ∏.
		/* public int read()
         throws IOException
Reads a single character.
Overrides:
read in class Reader
Returns:
The character read, or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached*/
	FileReader fr = new FileReader(fi); // > ø≠æÓº≠ √ππ¯¬∞ pointerø° ¿ßƒ°.
	int ch ; // int read ¿Ã±‚ ∂ßπÆø° int∑Œ πﬁæ∆º≠ ≥™¡ﬂø° «¸∫Ø»Ø¿ª «ÿ¡‹.
	while ((ch = fr.read()) != -1) { // stream¿Ã ≥°ø° ¥Í¿∏∏È return¿Ã -1¿Ãπ«∑Œ, ∞™¿Ã -1 µ…∂ß±Ó¡ˆ π›∫ππÆ
		// means, «—±€¿⁄æø ¿–æÓº≠ ∏Æ≈œ«œ¿⁄, æ¯¿∏∏È -1¿ª ∏Æ≈œ. º¯¬˜¡¢±Ÿ, 
		// «—±€¿⁄æø -1¿Ã æ∆¥“∂ß±Ó¡ˆ ¿–æÓº≠ ∏Æ≈œ.
		System.out.print((char)ch); // ch∞° int¿Ã±‚ ∂ßπÆø° char∑Œ «¸∫Ø»Ø
	}
	fr.close(); // close ¡÷ºÆ√≥∏Æ«ÿπˆ∏Æ∏È, lock ∞…∑¡º≠ exception µ» ªÛ≈¬, read - consoleø° æ»∫∏ø©¡‹. -Transaction.
		// ≥ π´ ¡ﬂø‰«œ¥œ±Ó π›µÂΩ√ ∏ÌΩ√«ÿ¡÷∞ÌΩÕ¿∫∞≈æﬂ. ±◊∑°º≠ try-with resource ±∏πÆ¿ª ¡÷¥¬∞≈æﬂ.
		
	}
}





214     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test\MTest07.java

package com.test;

import java.io.*;
// Stream¥‹¿ß∑Œ ¿–∞ÌΩ·∫∏¿⁄ (BYTE)
public class MTest07 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		File fi = new File("b.doc"); // øˆµÂ¥¬ ¿Œƒ⁄µ˘¿Ã¥ﬁ∂Ûº≠, µ˚∑Œ ¿€æ˜¿ª «ÿ¡‡æﬂ«’¥œ¥Ÿ. - webø°∞°∏È «’¥œ¥Ÿ.
		// java.lang ≈¨∑°Ω∫¿« String, πˆ∏± ∞Õ¿Ã æ¯¥¬ Class String
		// ª˝º∫¿⁄¿« character set . Class Charset - > stream¿∏∑Œ ∫Ø»Ø«ÿº≠ charset±Ó¡ˆ ¡‡∂Û.
		// A named mapping between sequences of sixteen-bit Unicode code units and sequences of bytes. This class defines methods for creating decoders and encoders and for retrieving the various names associated with a charset. Instances of this class are immutable. 
		
		try {
			My_Write(fi);
			My_Read(fi);
		} catch (Exception e) {
			System.out.println(e);
		}
	} // main

	public static void My_Write(File fi) throws IOException  {// mainø°º≠ exception √≥∏Æ«œ∂Û∞Ì ¥¯¡¸
		FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(fi); // Unhandled exception type FileNotFoundException
		//FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(fi,true); 
		//FileOutputStream(File file, boolean append) ==> √ﬂ∞°«œ±‚
//		Creates a file output stream to write to the file represented by the specified File object.
		
		
		fos.write(100);// Unhandled exception type IOException
		 // IOExcetion æ∆∑°ø° File not found exception¿Ã ¿÷±‚ ∂ßπÆø° πŸ≤„¡‡µµ ±¶√· 
		for(int i = 65 ; i <=90 ; i++)
		{
			fos.write(i);
		}
		fos.close();
		
	} // M_Wr

	public static void My_Read(File fi) throws IOException {
		
		FileInputStream fr = new FileInputStream(fi); // MTest 06ø° read øÕ ∂»∞∞¿Ω.
		 // Unhandled exception type FileNotFoundException
		int ch ; 
		// Unhandled exception type IOException ==> IOE ∑Œ ¥¯¡¸
		while ((ch = fr.read()) != -1) { 
			System.out.print((char)ch);
		}
	} // M_R

}

package com.test;
// stream(byte) read ( ) write ( ) : String ¥‹¿ß æ»µ .

//char type¿∏∑Œ read«“∂ß, String æ»µ . 
//--> char read( ) = string X
// ≥™¥¬ String¿∏∑Œ ¿–∞ÌΩÕ¥Ÿ, ±‚∫ª¿˚¿∏∑Œ ƒƒ«ª≈Õ¥¬ byte¥‹¿ß¿Ã±‚∂ßπÆø° «—±€¿⁄æø
// then, «—±€§∏æø ¿–æÓº≠ ¿”Ω√πÊ(«—±€¿⁄¥¬ -buffer <∫Ÿ¿Ã±‚(ctrl+c,v) «—π¯π€ø° æ»µ , flash¿Ã±‚ ∂ßπÆ>, «—±€¿⁄ ¿ÃªÛ¿∫ clip board) ø° ≥÷æÓ≥ı∞Ì, «œ≥™¿« πÆ¿⁄ø≠¿Ã ∏∏µÈæÓ¡˙∂ß±Ó¡ˆ ≥÷∞Ì, ∏∏µÈæÓ¡ˆ∏È read ()

import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;

// ∆ƒ¿œ∏∏µÈ∞Ì πˆ∆€ø°≥÷∞Ì ±◊¥„ø° ¿–æÓ
//1 ∞¥√º«œ≥™ ∏∏µÈæÓ
//2πˆ∆€¿Œ«≤Ω∫∆Æ∏≤ø°≥÷æÓ//
//3 ∆ƒ¿œ¿Œ«™Ω∫∆Æ∏≤ø°º≠¿–¿∏∏Èµ»¥¡¿˙§”

public class MTest08 {
	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
//		æµ∂ß¥¬ String æµºˆ¿÷æÓ (character πËø≠¿÷¿∏¥œ±Ó.) 
		
//ª˝º∫¿⁄ 	BufferedInputStream(InputStream in)  --- > InputStream Class InputStream --- > Subclasses: FileInputStream
	
		
	//	1. ∆ƒ¿œ§∑∏£ ∏∏µÈæÓ		
		File f = new File("a.png") ;
		FileInputStream fi = new FileInputStream(f);
		BufferedInputStream bi = new BufferedInputStream(fi);

//		bi∏¶ ¿–æÓº≠ fod§ƒ æ¥¥Ÿ.
		File res = new File("baby.png");
		FileOutputStream fo = new FileOutputStream(res);
		BufferedOutputStream bfo = new BufferedOutputStream(fo);
		
		int ch = 0;
		while((ch = bi.read()) != -1) {bfo.write(ch);}
		
		bfo.close();
		fo.close();
		bi.close();
		fi.close();
		
		
		
	//	Class BufferedInputStream : String ¿–¥¬ read∞° æ¯¥Ÿ. ±◊∑≥ ¥©∞° ¿÷¿ª∞°. 
	//	 ª˝º∫¿⁄∞° InputStream ,  (system, field, in¿« ∞¥√º∞° inputstream - public static final InputStream in
		//		 The "standard" input stream. This stream is already open and ready to supply input data. Typically this stream corresponds to keyboard input or another input source specified by the host environment or user. ) 
		 // InputStream  ø©±‚ø° system in¿ª æµ ºˆ ¿÷¥Ÿ¥¬∞≈¡ˆ. 
		// ∆ƒ¿œ¿«§” ¥ÎªÛ¿ª πŸ¿Ã∆Æ ¥‹¿ß∑Œ πˆ∆€∏¶ ªÁøÎ«“∂ß¥¬ BufferedInputStream∏¶ ªÁøÎ.
		// byte¥‹¿ß∑Œ √≥∏Æµ«¥¬ ∞Õ, ¿ÃπÃ¡ˆ, µøøµªÛ, ¿Ωº∫∆ƒ¿œ µÓ  - byte¥¬ ¥ÎªÛ¿Ã µ¸ ¡§«ÿ¡Æ¿÷¿Ω.
		// ¥ÎªÛ¿ª ∆ƒ¿œø°º≠ ¿–æÓº≠ ∆ƒ¿œ∑Œ æ≤∞⁄¥Ÿ.
	//	 Class BufferedReader : String  readLine() : Reads a line of text.
		// §§ 
		
	}

}

package com.test;

import java.io.*;

public class MTest22 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		File fi = new File("C:\\MyTest02");
		if (fi.exists()) {
			System.out.println("±◊∆ƒ¿œ π˙Ω· ¿÷Ω¿¥œ¥Ÿ.");
		} else {
			fi.mkdir();
			System.out.println("∆ƒ¿œ¿ª ª˝º∫«œø¥Ω¿¥œ¥Ÿ.");
		}
		String mydir = "CC";
		My_mkdir(fi, mydir);
		mydir = "DD";
		My_mkdir(fi, mydir); // method∏¶ ∏∏µÈæÓº≠ directory∏¶ ≥—±Ë

	}

	public static void My_mkdir(File f, String str) {
		File fi = new File(f, str);
		fi.mkdir();

	}

}





217     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\Address.java

package com.test01;

import java.io.Serializable;

public class Address implements Serializable {

	private String name;
	private transient String addr; // π´»ø»≠ (æ»∫∏≥ª∞ÌΩÕ¿ª∂ß)
	private  static String tel;
	
	public Address() {
		super();
	}

	public Address(String name, String addr, String tel) {
		super();
		this.name = name;
		this.addr = addr;
		this.tel = tel;
	}

	@Override
	public String toString() {
		return "Address [name=" + name + ", addr=" + addr + ", tel=" + tel + "]";
	}


	
	
}





218     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\MTest01.java

package com.test01;
// buffered reader ,writer
import java.io.*;
// char∏¶ ¿–∞Ì æ≤¥¬µ•, ¥‹ bufferø° ¥„¥¬ πˆ∆€∏µ¿∏ «ÿ∫∏¿⁄.
// ∆ƒ¿œ∞¥√º, file reader (¿–∞Ì), buffered reader (πˆ∆€∏µ) => ReadLine
// «—±€¿⁄æø ≥÷¿∏∏È, ≤®≥æ∂ß¥¬ πÆ¿⁄ø≠∫∞∑Œ read line.
public class MTest01 {
	
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
	FileReader fr = new FileReader("b.txt");
	BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(fr); // String¿∏∑Œ ∏Æ§√§§¿ª «ÿ¡‹.
	String str = null;

//	public String readLine()
//Reads a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed.
	//A String containing the contents of the line, not including any line-termination characters, or null if the end of the stream has been reached
//	BufferedReader(Reader in, int sz) 
	//Creates a buffering character-input stream that uses an input buffer of the specified size.
	// §§ ªÁ¿Ã¡Ó∏¶ æÓ∂ª∞‘ æÀæ∆, 
	while ( (str = br.readLine()) != null) { //readLine¿Ã ¥Ÿ ¿–¿∏∏È null ∏Æ≈œ
		System.out.println(str);
	}
br.close();
fr.close();
}	

}





219     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\MTest02.java

package com.test01;

import java.io.*;

// Stream¥‹¿ß∑Œ ¿–∞ÌΩ·∫∏¿⁄ (BYTE)
public class MTest02 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		File fi = new File("b.txt"); //
		try {
			My_Write(fi);
			My_Read(fi);
		} catch (Exception e) {
			System.out.println(e);
		}
	} // main

	public static void My_Write(File fi) {
		// jdk 7version Try catch∑Œ exception «œ≥™æø ¥Ÿ ¿‚¿ª ∂ß ¿Ã∑∏∞‘ æ¥¥Ÿ.
		// The try-with-resources statement ensures that each resource is closed at the end of the statement.  Any object that implements java.lang.AutoCloseable, which includes all objects which implement java.io.Closeable, can be used as a resource.
		FileOutputStream fos = null;
		try {
			fos = new FileOutputStream(fi);
			for (int i = 65; i <= 90; i++) {
				fos.write(i);
			}
		} catch (FileNotFoundException f) {

		} catch (IOException i) {

		} finally {

			try {
				fos.close();
			} catch (IOException e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
	}
	// ø¯∑° π›µÂΩ√ fos.close() ; --< exception¿Ã πﬂòÀ¥œ±Ó, try-catch∏¶ «œ¥¬∞Õ.

	public static void My_Write02(File fi) {
		// jdk 7version

		try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(fi)) // æÍ¥¬ πŸ±˘ø° ¿÷¥¬ æ÷¥¬ ¿ŒΩƒ«œ¡ˆ ∏¯«œ±‚ ∂ßπÆø° æ»ø° ≥÷æÓ¡‹
		// catch ±∏πÆ¿Ã ≥°≥Ø∂ß ¿⁄µø¿∏∑Œ º“∏Íµ«±‚ ¥ÎπÆ¿Ã ¿⁄µø close. ¿Ã∞‘ ∏≈øÏ ≈©∞‘ ª˝∞¢«—¥‰¥œ¥Ÿ.
		// outer excepiont ¿‚¿ª ºˆ ¿÷∞‘ ≥™¡ﬂø° ∂·¥Ÿ. // exception¿∫ ¥‹¿ß∫∞∑Œ «œ≥™æø √≥∏Æ«ÿæﬂ«œ¥¬µ•, outer √≥∏Æ«ÿπˆ∏Æ∏È
		// æ»ø°¿÷¥¬ exception¿∫ ≥ıƒ• ºˆ ¿÷¥Ÿ.
		//
		{
			for (int i = 65; i <= 90; i++) {
				try {
					fos.write(i); // inner exception ¿‚¿ª ºˆ ¿÷∞‘ ∏’¿˙ µÂ∞Ì,
				} catch (IOException e) {
					e.printStackTrace();
				}
			}
		} catch (FileNotFoundException e1) {
			e1.printStackTrace();
		} catch (IOException e1) {
			e1.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

	public static void My_Read(File fi)  {

		try (FileInputStream fr = new FileInputStream(fi)) {

			int ch;

			while ((ch = fr.read()) != -1) {
				System.out.print((char) ch);
			}
		} catch (Exception e) { // Close∞° æ¯¥¬µ• ? æÓ∂ª∞‘ close∞° µ  ? The try-with-resources statement ensures that each resource is closed at the end of the statement.
			// https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/exceptions/tryResourceClose.html
		}
	} // M_R

}





220     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\MTest03.java

package com.test01;

import java.io.*;

//The try-with-resources Statement ¿∏«„¿∏«„
public class MTest03 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
		File fi = new File("a.txt");
		try (FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(fi)) {
			fw.write("æˆ∏∂æˆ∏∂\n");
			fw.write("æ∆∫¸æ∆∫¸ \t");
			fw.write("π⁄¿Œæ∆µ≈¡ˆ \n");
		} catch (Exception e) {
		}

		try (FileReader fr = new FileReader(fi)) {
			int ch;
			while ((ch = fr.read()) != -1) {

				System.out.print((char) ch);
			}
		} catch (Exception e) {
		}
		//	fr.close(); // close ¡÷ºÆ√≥∏Æ«ÿπˆ∏Æ∏È, lock ∞…∑¡º≠ exception µ» ªÛ≈¬, read - consoleø° æ»∫∏ø©¡‹. -Transaction.
		// ≥ π´ ¡ﬂø‰«œ¥œ±Ó π›µÂΩ√ ∏ÌΩ√«ÿ¡÷∞ÌΩÕ¿∫∞≈æﬂ. ±◊∑°º≠ try-with resource ±∏πÆ¿ª ¡÷¥¬∞≈æﬂ.
		// «ŸΩ…¿∫ Any object that implements java.lang.AutoCloseable, which includes all
		// objects which implement java.io.Closeable, can be used as a resource.`
	}
}





221     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\MTest04.java

package com.test01;
import java.io.*;
public class MTest04 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
		DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream("e.txt"));
				
//DataOutputStream(OutputStream out) --> Class OutputStream∏¶ ∏≈∞≥¿Œ¿⁄∑Œ æµºˆ¿÷¥Ÿ.
//<Direct Known Subclasses:
//ByteArrayOutputStream, FileOutputStream, FilterOutputStream, ObjectOutputStream, OutputStream, PipedOutputStream>
	
		dos.writeInt(100);
		dos.writeDouble(90.9);
		dos.writeUTF("abc");
		dos.close();
		
		
		DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(new FileInputStream("e.txt"));
		System.out.println(dis.readInt());
		System.out.println(dis.readDouble());
		System.out.println(dis.readUTF());
		dis.close();
		
		
	}
}





222     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\MTest05.java

package com.test01;

// line number Ω√∏Æ¡Ó∏¶ Ω·∫æΩ√¥Ÿ. public class LineNumberReader
// LineNumberReader(Reader in)  ∞¥√º∞° reader
import java.io.*;

public class MTest05 {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {

		LineNumberReader r = new LineNumberReader(new FileReader("b.txt"));
		int ch = 0;
//		System.out.print(r.getLineNumber()+"=>");
		//r.setLineNumber(0);
		System.out.printf("%5d).", 1);
		while ((ch = r.read()) != -1) {
		
			if ((char) ch == '\n') {
//A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed.

				System.out.printf("%5d).\n", r.getLineNumber()+1);
		
			} else {	System.out.print((char) ch);}
			
		}
		r.close();
	}

}





223     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\MTest06.java

package com.test01;
// object io
import java.io.*;
public class MTest06 {
//	writeObject(Object obj) 
//	Write the specified object to the ObjectOutputStream.
// ∞¥√º read/write«“∂ß, ¡˜∑ƒ»≠ ¿ÿ¡ˆ∏ª∞Õ.
	
	public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
		ObjectOutputStream oos = new ObjectOutputStream(new FileOutputStream("data.txt"));
		// Exception in thread "main" java.io.NotSerializableException : java.io. Interface Serializable
		// ¡˜∑ƒ»≠ Ω√≈∞¥Ÿ.(serialize) : file  ==> implements Addressø°º≠ ¡˜∑ƒ»≠
		oos.writeObject(new Address("111","111","111")) ;
		oos.writeObject(new Address("222","222","222")) ;
		oos.writeObject(new Address("333","333","333")) ;
		oos.writeObject(new Address("444","444","444")) ;
		oos.close();

		ObjectInputStream ois = new ObjectInputStream(new FileInputStream("data.txt"));
		System.out.println(ois.readObject());
		System.out.println(ois.readObject());
		System.out.println(ois.readObject());
		System.out.println(ois.readObject());

		ois.close();
	}
	
}

package com.test01;

import java.io.*;

public class MTest07 {

		File f = new File("b.txt");
		Scanner sc = new Scanner(f);

		}
	}

225     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY21\src\com\test01\MTest22.java

package com.test01;

import java.io.*;

//The try-with-resources Statement ¿∏«„¿∏«„
public class MTest22 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		File fi = new File("b.txt"); //
		try {
			My_Write(fi);
			My_Read(fi);
		} catch (Exception e) {
			System.out.println(e);
		}
	} // main

	public static void My_Write(File fi) {
		// jdk 7version Try catch∑Œ exception «œ≥™æø ¥Ÿ ¿‚¿ª ∂ß ¿Ã∑∏∞‘ æ¥¥Ÿ.
		FileOutputStream fos = null;
		try {
			fos = new FileOutputStream(fi);
			for (int i = 65; i <= 90; i++) {
				fos.write(i);
			}
		} catch (FileNotFoundException f) {

		} catch (IOException i) {

		} finally {

			try {
				fos.close();
			} catch (IOException e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
		}
	}
	// ø¯∑° π›µÂΩ√ fos.close() ; --< exception¿Ã πﬂòÀ¥œ±Ó, try-catch∏¶ «œ¥¬∞Õ.

	public static void My_Write02(File fi) {
		// jdk 7version

		try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(fi)) // æÍ¥¬ πŸ±˘ø° ¿÷¥¬ æ÷¥¬ ¿ŒΩƒ«œ¡ˆ ∏¯«œ±‚ ∂ßπÆø° æ»ø° ≥÷æÓ¡‹
		// catch ±∏πÆ¿Ã ≥°≥Ø∂ß ¿⁄µø¿∏∑Œ º“∏Íµ«±‚ ¥ÎπÆ¿Ã ¿⁄µø close. ¿Ã∞‘ ∏≈øÏ ≈©∞‘ ª˝∞¢«—¥‰¥œ¥Ÿ.
		// outer excepiont ¿‚¿ª ºˆ ¿÷∞‘ ≥™¡ﬂø° ∂·¥Ÿ. // exception¿∫ ¥‹¿ß∫∞∑Œ «œ≥™æø √≥∏Æ«ÿæﬂ«œ¥¬µ•, outer √≥∏Æ«ÿπˆ∏Æ∏È æ»ø°¿÷¥¬ exception¿∫ ≥ıƒ• ºˆ ¿÷¥Ÿ.
		// 
		{
			for (int i = 65; i <= 90; i++) {
				try {
					fos.write(i); // inner exception ¿‚¿ª ºˆ ¿÷∞‘ ∏’¿˙ µÂ∞Ì, 
				} catch (IOException e) {
					e.printStackTrace();
				}
			}} catch (FileNotFoundException e1) {
				e1.printStackTrace();
			} catch (IOException e1) {
				e1.printStackTrace();
			} 
	}

	public static void My_Read(File fi) throws IOException {

		FileInputStream fr = new FileInputStream(fi);

		int ch;

		while ((ch = fr.read()) != -1) {
			System.out.print((char) ch);
		}
	} // M_R

}

227     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY22\src\com\test\MTest02.java

package com.test;
// Class StringTokenizer (java.util.StringTokenizer)
/* public StringTokenizer(String str, String delim)
The characters in the delim argument are the delimiters for separating tokens. Delimiter characters themselves will not be treated as tokens. 

The tokenizer uses the default delimiter set, which is " \t\n\r\f": the space character, the tab character, the newline character, the carriage-return character, and the form-feed character. Delimiter characters themselves will not be treated as tokens.


*/
import java.util.*;
public class MTest02 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		String str = "	public\t static\\t void '\t' main(String[]\"\t\" args) " ;
		StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str);
		System.out.println(st.countTokens());
		while(st.hasMoreTokens()) {
//			System.out.println(st.nextToken()+ "," + st.countTokens());
			System.out.println(st.nextToken());

		
		}
		
	
	}

}

import java.util.*;

		Scanner sc = new Scanner(str).useDelimiter("[a|d]");
		System.out.println(sc.delimiter()); // \p{javaWhitespace} : ¿⁄πŸ∏∏ ±∏∫–«“ ºˆ ¿÷¥¬ ∆Ø¡§ ªÛºˆ ∞∞¿∫∞≈ ? // d
		while (sc.hasNext()) {
			System.out.println(sc.next());
		}
	}
}





229     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY22\src\com\test\MTest04.java

package com.test;

import java.util.regex.*;

// 1 pattern : regular expression ƒƒ∆ƒ¿œ
// 2 Matcher : pattern¿Ã ¿‘∑¬«— πÆ¿⁄ø≠∞˙ ∏¬¥¬¡ˆ ¿Øπ´∏¶ »Æ¿Œ
// 3 pattern syntax Exception : ∆–≈œπÆπ˝¿Ã ∏¬¡ˆ æ ¿ª ∞ÊøÏ πﬂª˝«œ¥¬ ¿Ã∫•∆Æ

public class MTest04 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Prn();
		Prn02();
		Prn03();
	}
	public static void Prn() {
		Pattern p = Pattern.compile("abcd \\d"); // 1 ¥‹∞Ë compile «œ∞Ì
		String candidate = "abcd 4";
		Matcher m = p.matcher(candidate);
		if (m != null) {
			System.out.println(m.find());
		}
	}
	
	public static void Prn02 () {
		String regex = "\\w+\\s"; // + = 1 more // * = 0 more 
		Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile(regex) ; // ∞¯πÈ√≥∏Æ«ÿ¡÷¥¬∞≈ æ¯¥Ÿ.  
		String candidate = "playdata.io abcd";
		Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(candidate);
		
		if(matcher.find()) {
			System.out.println("GROUP 0 :"+ matcher.group(0)+"<==");
		}
	}
	
	public static void Prn03() {
		String regex = "(\\d{3})(\\d{3})(\\d{4})";
		Pattern p = Pattern.compile(regex);
		String source = "1234567890, 12345 and 9876543210";
		
		Matcher m = p.matcher(source);
		// m : java.util.regex.Matcher[pattern=(\d{3})(\d{3})(\d{4}) region=0,32 lastmatch=1234567890]
		while(m.find())		{
			System.out.println("Phone:" + m.group(0)); //  m.group(0) = m.group()
			System.out.println("("+m.group(1)+")"+m.group(2) + "-" + m.group(3));
			System.out.println("m : "+ m);
		}
				
				
				
	}
}

package com.test;

import java.nio.file.FileSystem;
import java.nio.file.FileSystems;
import java.nio.file.Path;

public class PathTest {
public static void main(String[] args) {
	FileSystem fileSystem = FileSystems.getDefault();
	System.out.println(fileSystem);
	Path path1 = fileSystem.getPath("data/foo.txt");
	System.out.println(path1);
	
	Path path2 = fileSystem.getPath("data/a","b","c","bar.txt");
	System.out.println(path2);
	
	Path path3 = fileSystem.getPath("data/baz.txt");
	System.out.println(path3);
}
}





231     >>>>>    path D:\02_ENCORE\Playdata_0516\JavaWork\DAY22\src\com\test\PathTest01.java

package com.test;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.nio.file.LinkOption;
import java.nio.file.Path;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class PathTest01 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {

		Path path = Paths.get("C:\\MyTest02\\AA\\a.txt"); // Ω«¡¶∆ƒ¿œ æ¯¿∏∏È Exception
		System.out.printf("Root   : %s  \n", path.getRoot());
		System.out.printf("Parent : %s  \n", path.getParent());

		for (int i = 0; i < path.getNameCount(); i++) {
			System.out.printf("getNameCount  %d : %s  \n", i, path.getName(i));
		}

		System.out.printf("subpath : %s \n", path.subpath(0, path.getNameCount()));
		System.out.println();

		try {
			Path real_path = path.toRealPath(LinkOption.NOFOLLOW_LINKS);
			System.out.println(real_path);
			
			File path_to_file = path.toFile();
			Path file_to_path = path_to_file.toPath();
			System.out.printf("Path to file name : %s \n", path_to_file.getName());
			System.out.printf("file to path name : %s \n", file_to_path.toString());

		} catch (IOException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}

	}
}

		System.out.println("Main¿« ≥°====");
		System.out.println("Main¿« ≥°====");
		System.out.println("Main¿« ≥°====");

	}

	@Override
	public void run() {
